programme.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 2
Kill Bill 2
Kill Bill: Vol. 2
programme.desc: Kill Bill: Vol. 2: Directed by Quentin Tarantino. With Vivica A. Fox, Ambrosia Kelley, Michael Parks, James Parks. The Bride continues her quest of vengeance against her former boss and lover Bill, the reclusive bouncer Budd, and the treacherous, one-eyed Elle." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0378194/","name":"Kill Bill: Vol. 2","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmFiYmJmN2QtNWQwMi00MzliLThiOWMtZjQxNGRhZTQ1MjgyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzQ1ODk3MTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Bride continues her quest of vengeance against her former boss and lover Bill, the reclusive bouncer Budd, and the treacherous, one-eyed Elle.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0378194/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Coventry"},"dateCreated":"2004-04-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Tarantino's Triumph: Volume Two","reviewBody":"Rarely \tknown a movie I've been looking forward to so much than Q.T's resumption of the Kill Bill saga. I, as well as millions of others film-freaks, awaited Uma Thurman's further adventures with wicked anticipation. And of course Tarantino didn't disappoint. Volume two is a completely different movie than volume one, but it's equally brilliant and the director's trademarks are shown more than obviously. Volume one merely was homage to the Eastern Martial Arts movies, with delightfully over-the-top splatter and gore while Vol. 2 fully focuses on ancient westerns and rural horror. There's more dialogue, more twists n turns and the anti-chronological structure results in more depth and involvement. Some unexplained elements from Vol.1 become clear now and even the entire background of Thurman's character gets unveiled. For the very first time, (as far as I can remember) Tarantino really knows how to create an unbearable tension! There's a sequence in which Uma is buried alive and trapped under the ground Through simple methods, like a completely black screen, Tarantino arises claustrophobia among the audience! Truly terrific filmmaking. \n\nThe actors in Kill Bill aren't Hollywood's best, but they each have their charisma and their typical Tarantino characters do the rest. The camera viewpoints are brilliant at times and  as usual  the tiny absurd elements are a joy to discover. Tarantino's entire Kill Bill achievement may easily be considered as one of the most creative and dared film-projects ever! Do yourself a favor and watch them! Over and over again.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":719464,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2004-12-08","keywords":"bride,vengeance,revenge,female assassin,martial arts","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Kill Bill: Vol. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi405667865","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjA3OThlOWUtZWZiYi00M2I2LTg0Y2QtNWY2YThjZjE4Y2U1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjA3OThlOWUtZWZiYi00M2I2LTg0Y2QtNWY2YThjZjE4Y2U1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"CT #1, post"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000235/","name":"Uma Thurman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001016/","name":"David Carradine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000514/","name":"Michael Madsen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000233/","name":"Quentin Tarantino"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022594/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019267/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0086625/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000233/","name":"Quentin Tarantino"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000235/","name":"Uma Thurman"}],"duration":"PT2H17M"}</script><metacontent="

I, as well as millions of others film-freaks, awaited Uma Thurman's further adventures with wicked anticipation. And of course Tarantino didn't disappoint. Volume two is a completely different movie than volume one, but it's equally brilliant and the director's trademarks are shown more than obviously. Volume one merely was homage to the Eastern Martial Arts movies, with delightfully over-the-top splatter and gore while Vol. 2 fully focuses on ancient westerns and rural horror. programme.title: Knowing
Zapowiedź
Knowing
programme.desc:
Knowing: Directed by Alex Proyas. With Nicolas Cage, Chandler Canterbury, Rose Byrne, Lara Robinson. M.I.T. professor John Koestler links a mysterious list of numbers from a time capsule to past and future disasters and sets out to prevent the ultimate catastrophe." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0448011/","name":"Knowing","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMyMjgyMDIyM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjg3MjAyMg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"M.I.T. professor John Koestler links a mysterious list of numbers from a time capsule to past and future disasters and sets out to prevent the ultimate catastrophe.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0448011/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"pugmahorn"},"dateCreated":"2009-03-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Good, The Bad and the Ugly","reviewBody":"The good: Strong start to the movie, the plot hooks you in, excellent sound, confronting disaster scenes, haunting images, Rose Byrne, at times quite freaky, The Bad: Special effects looked like they were from a video game, ripped off basically every science fiction movie ever made, poor acting from Nic Cage, very predictable.

The Ugly: Last third of movie was shamefully ridiculous.

Summary: If you are a science fiction fan, you will probably not be able to resist seeing this movie. Be warned, you will think you are seeing the sci-fi great that you have been waiting for but mid way the film gets lost. You may very well groan out loud at the ending. This had the makings of a great movie but unfortunately it couldn't come up with the goods.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":228342,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Drama","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2009-04-22","keywords":"end of the world,number,disaster,time capsule,code","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Knowing: TV Spot","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3391554329","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzI1NDU5OTYzNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTU4NjYzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzI1NDU5OTYzNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTU4NjYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Here is the TV trailer for Knowing, directed by Alex Proyas and starring Nicholas Cage."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000115/","name":"Nicolas Cage"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2425105/","name":"Chandler Canterbury"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0126284/","name":"Rose Byrne"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001639/","name":"Alex Proyas"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046206/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035535/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052515/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0669379/","name":"Ryne Douglas Pearson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1340000/","name":"Juliet Snowden"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0925482/","name":"Stiles White"}],"duration":"PT2H1M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Mercury Rising
Kod Merkury
Mercury Rising
programme.desc:
Mercury Rising: Directed by Harold Becker. With Bruce Willis, Alec Baldwin, Miko Hughes, Chi McBride. Shadowy elements in the NSA target a nine-year old autistic savant for death when he is able to decipher a top secret code." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120749/","name":"Mercury Rising","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODA2NmY4NDEtNjk1Yi00NmI1LTgwMjEtYWZmMjRmMDUyMTlkL2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Shadowy elements in the NSA target a nine-year old autistic savant for death when he is able to decipher a top secret code.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120749/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"johniebegood"},"dateCreated":"2004-08-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Better Circa 2004","reviewBody":"I just watcehd this on DVD, loved it and was literally stunned to find that most people, in particular those that write movie reviews for a living slated this. 

Maybe its because in 2004, some six years after its original release we are seeing a revival of the action/thriller (Bourne Supremacy etc).

So, what didn't I like, not much. I would like to have seen more made of the kids codebreaking, they could really have milked that and didn't, the opening scene was just to cliché in setting up Willis's character as were the characters of his big black boss and hard nosed chief. The very last scene was typical US syrup but was thankfully very short.

What was good? everything else, I loved the idea behind the story, Miko Hughes is totally amazing to the point I had to check the next day to find out how the hell they managed to get a autistic kid to act (is isn't autistic but is a damn fine actor), Willis really does add vulnerability to a role that he has played many times before, with the movie underpinned fantastically with a John Barry soundscore and Harold Becker carefully crafts what for me was a very enjoyable movie watching experience and stands head and shoulders above many I have seen recently. 3/5 for me","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":72259,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"1998-04-03","keywords":"autistic child,autism,assassin,9 year old,hospital","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000246/","name":"Bruce Willis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0400816/","name":"Miko Hughes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000285/","name":"Alec Baldwin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000887/","name":"Harold Becker"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003687/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0669379/","name":"Ryne Douglas Pearson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0465199/","name":"Lawrence Konner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0742797/","name":"Mark Rosenthal"}],"duration":"PT1H51M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0120749, Title: Mercury Rising, --- Description: Mercury Rising: Directed by Harold Becker. With Bruce Willis, Alec Baldwin, Miko Hughes, Chi McBride. Shadowy elements in the NSA target a nine-year old autistic savant for death when he is able to decipher a top secret code." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120749/","name":"Mercury Rising","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODA2NmY4NDEtNjk1Yi00NmI1LTgwMjEtYWZmMjRmMDUyMTlkL2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Shadowy elements in the NSA target a nine-year old autistic savant for death when he is able to decipher a top secret code.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120749/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"johniebegood","dateCreated":"2004-08-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Better Circa 2004","reviewBody":"I just watcehd this on DVD, loved it and was literally stunned to find that most people, in particular those that write movie reviews for a living slated this. 

Maybe its because in 2004, some six years after its original release we are seeing a revival of the action/thriller (Bourne Supremacy etc).

So, what didn't I like, not much. I would like to have seen more made of the kids codebreaking, they could really have milked that and didn't, the opening scene was just to cliché in setting up Willis's character as were the characters of his big black boss and hard nosed chief. The very last scene was typical US syrup but was thankfully very short.

What was good? everything else, I loved the idea behind the story, Miko Hughes is totally amazing to the point I had to check the next day to find out how the hell they managed to get a autistic kid to act (is isn't autistic but is a damn fine actor), Willis really does add vulnerability to a role that he has played many times before, with the movie underpinned fantastically with a John Barry soundscore and Harold Becker carefully crafts what for me was a very enjoyable movie watching experience and stands head and shoulders above many I have seen recently. 3/5 for me","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":72259,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"1998-04-03","keywords":"autistic child,autism,assassin,9 year old,hospital","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000246/","name":"Bruce Willis","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0400816/","name":"Miko Hughes","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000285/","name":"Alec Baldwin"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000887/","name":"Harold Becker"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003687/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0669379/","name":"Ryne Douglas Pearson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0465199/","name":"Lawrence Konner","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0742797/","name":"Mark Rosenthal"],"duration":"PT1H51M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Duelles
Instynkt matki
Duelles
programme.desc:
Duelles: Directed by Olivier Masset-Depasse. With Veerle Baetens, Anne Coesens, Mehdi Nebbou, Arieh Worthalter. When a sudden tragedy uproots the lives of two women and their families, they begin to question the relationships they once held so dear, in this psychological thriller from Olivier Masset-Depass." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7377132/","name":"Duelles","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDk0ZGNlNDctNWRiNy00YzUxLTgyMzEtMWNiMGEyYWUzODNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTc5OTMwOTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a sudden tragedy uproots the lives of two women and their families, they begin to question the relationships they once held so dear, in this psychological thriller from Olivier Masset-Depass.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7377132/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"TheDragonTrader"},"dateCreated":"2021-05-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"A slowly illuminating red light","reviewBody":"After a tragic accident shatters the friendly alliance between two neighbours, they start harassing each other to find out who really was responsible for what happened. While the audience at first thinks it was a perfectly banal accident, their doubt is being fuelled scene after scene...

Veerle Baetens' en Anne Coessens' performances are filled with subtle mistrust and held-back anger. These two characters playing off each other are a true feast for the spectators. Also the young Jules Lefebre acts with a maturity beyond his years. The cinematography by Hichame Alaouie is effective and - even though the pace at times threatens to slow down a bit too much - keeps every scene interesting and fresh: playing with angles, lighting and other effects to signify the slow descent into madness. Olivier Masset-Depasses' direction is clean, whilst never sinking into blandness.

However, the omnipresent score is overblown and lacks subtlety, but regularly does capture the right atmosphere for the scene. The story after a while threatens to loose its own point, but regains its footing again in the finale. And what a chilling finale that was! One last nit-picking comment can be that the film could have raised uncertainty and suspicion even more than it in fact did.

Finally, one cannot ignore the not-so-subtle hints to Hitchcock's work in the production design, costumes and building of tension. It's expertly done and - in my humble opinion - this movie is perfectly capable of standing between great names such as 'Rear Window' and 'The Man Who Knew Too Much'. A shame it only came out in 2018, because back in the 60's, it would have perplexed it's audiences. It's not without drawbacks, but then again... which one of Hitchcock wasn't?","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1439,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"genre":["Drama","Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2019-04-17","keywords":"female friends,paranoia,death of a child,deadly fall,conflict between friends","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4235639321","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzg0NWI3ZjgtY2JhMi00YTI3LTg1ZWEtMmM1YTliM2JlYzExXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzg0NWI3ZjgtY2JhMi00YTI3LTg1ZWEtMmM1YTliM2JlYzExXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0046424/","name":"Veerle Baetens"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0168783/","name":"Anne Coesens"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0623854/","name":"Mehdi Nebbou"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0557267/","name":"Olivier Masset-Depasse"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0071388/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030799/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0282520/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3038158/","name":"Barbara Abel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0311488/","name":"Giordano Gederlini"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0557267/","name":"Olivier Masset-Depasse"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Kiler-ów 2-óch: Directed by Juliusz Machulski. With Cezary Pazura, Malgorzata Kozuchowska, Janusz Rewinski, Jerzy Stuhr. He must oversee a transfer of a substantial amount of gold. However, in his past activities, he has made enemies. Mighty ones. programme.desc: Maja (Selena Marsenic), sześcioletnia Serbka, przeprowadza się wraz z rodzicami do Danii. Jest nieco onieśmielona i wiele elementów codziennego dnia jest dla niej niezrozumiałych. Szczególnie utrudniona jest jej relacja z innymi dziećmi.

programme.desc: Roads: Directed by Sebastian Schipper. With Fionn Whitehead, Stéphane Bak, Ben Chaplin, Moritz Bleibtreu. Two lost teenage boys, from Congo and Britain, meet in Morocco and take a road trip in a stolen RV to France, encountering poverty and refugees on the way." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7303530/","name":"Roads","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2RiN2IyY2QtYjU4ZC00MjM0LTkwMjUtZjVlOTBlNjgzYmJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjE2ODIzMTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two lost teenage boys, from Congo and Britain, meet in Morocco and take a road trip in a stolen RV to France, encountering poverty and refugees on the way.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7303530/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"xplaneten"},"dateCreated":"2019-10-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Stunning movie, more than worth the watch.","reviewBody":"Everything just clicks, the plot, the actors, the authentic scenery, everything. It felt like I was watching the actual events happening, which we know from the news... The movie was very well directed and produced. P.S. It's best to ignore bernardconneely's review. His review is not about the movie itself but about politics and his own views on it. His review does not make sense whatsoever. programme.title: Ewolucja Jackiego Chana
programme.desc: Kulisy spektakularnej kariery Jackiego Chana. Tego znanego artystę można nazwać człowiekiem instytucją. Oprócz tego że jest cenionym aktorem, pracuje także jako kaskader, scenarzysta i reżyser, a także biznesmen. Jak nikt inny w branży filmowej potrafi widowiskowo łączyć azjatyckie kino sztuk walki z chaplinowskim humorem oraz hollywoodzkim rozmachem.

programme.title: Fågelfångarens Son
W pułapce myśliwego
The Birdcatcher
programme.desc: Fågelfångarens Son: Directed by Richard Hobert. With Rudi Køhnke, Vígdis Eliesersdóttir Hentze Bjørck, Livia Millhagen, Hedda Rehnberg. Plot Summary It's the late 1800's and the birdcatcher Esmar and his wife Johanna are trying to survive on the harsh dramatic cliffs of the Faroe Islands. Local law dictates that unless they have a son, an heir to the hold on their land, they will be evicted. When Johanna gives birth to their third daughter, with time on the lease running out, they become desperate. A friend, innkeeper Livia, suggests that the only way for Johanna to have a son might be to be impregnated by another man. It's unthinkable, but they are pushed to the brink. When they employ Livia's lover, the "French Captain" to do the deed, none of. them can understand the ultimate consequences of their choices." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7552784/","name":"Fågelfångarens Son","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmNiN2MzMDgtMWYyNy00NmNmLWFhYzQtNzFlYzgwMzRhMTUzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzAzMTAyNjU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Plot Summary It's the late 1800's and the birdcatcher Esmar and his wife Johanna are trying to survive on the harsh dramatic cliffs of the Faroe Islands. programme.title: Swing Vote
Najważniejszy głos
Swing Vote
programme.desc:
Swing Vote: Directed by Joshua Michael Stern. With Kevin Costner, Madeline Carroll, Paula Patton, Kelsey Grammer. In a remarkable turn-of-events, the result of the presidential election comes down to one man's vote." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1027862/","name":"Swing Vote","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAwMTQyNzkwNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTgyMzE3MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In a remarkable turn-of-events, the result of the presidential election comes down to one man's vote.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1027862/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"MLDinTN"},"dateCreated":"2009-08-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"entertaining although not plausible","reviewBody":"Kevin Costner was actually in another decent movie. His last movie I saw, Mr. Brooks, was pretty good also. I would call this movie a political satire, that tries to be a little funny at times. However, the idea that one guy determines the presidential election is absurd, but if you can get past that, then the plot is OK. It was funny how the movie had the political parties doing adds for things they oppose. Example, the democrats supporting pro life because Bud says he's pro life.

The plot is struggling, every day man, Bud Johnson, just got laid off. He has a very smart daughter and she cares about the presidential election. Bud promises to vote since Molly thinks it's important. But, when he doesn't show, Molly votes in his place but the power goes out and the vote didn't count. The election comes down to New Mexico and for some reason, not told in the movie, Bud's vote will decide the electoral votes. I mean, how could the votes be even for each side and even if they were very close, how many months would it take for all the recounts that would take place. But any way, it's up to Bud, whom doesn't care about politics. He becomes an instant celebrity and is courted by both candidates. By the end of the film, Bud grows an appreciation for the political scene and realizes that it is important to care about social issues.

FINAL VERDICT: Funnier than I thought and provides a message. Plus, the movie doesn't try to say that one party is better than the other.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":18365,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2008-08-01","keywords":"awakened by one's daughter,father daughter relationship,presidential candidate,election returns,election coverage","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Swing Vote","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2363687193","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEwMDM1OTc1NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTA0MDczMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEwMDM1OTc1NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTA0MDczMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Swing Vote Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000126/","name":"Kevin Costner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1745736/","name":"Paula Patton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001288/","name":"Kelsey Grammer"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0827750/","name":"Joshua Michael Stern"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049348/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023815/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0237137/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0725034/","name":"Jason Richman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0827750/","name":"Joshua Michael Stern"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1250389/","name":"David Giammarco"}],"duration":"PT2H"}</script><metacontent="

Pod ciemnymi gwiazdami

programme.title: The Lost Son
Zaginiony syn
The Lost Son
programme.desc:
The Lost Son: Directed by Chris Menges. With Daniel Auteuil, Nastassja Kinski, Katrin Cartlidge, Marianne Denicourt. Xavier Lombard is a world-weary private eye in London, in exile from his native Paris; his best friend is Nathalie, a high-class call girl. He gets a call from an old friend from the Paris police department, now a businessman whose brother-in-law is missing. The missing man's parents hire Xavier over their daughter's objections, and quickly he finds himself in the realm of children's sexual slavery. He guesses that the lost son is dead and shifts his focus to finding and breaking this lucrative business of child trafficking. He involves a reluctant Nathalie to hunt "the Austrian," the shadowy head of the business. Violence erupts quickly, and Xavier soon has little more to lose." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0144286/","name":"The Lost Son","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzE5MjE2ODUwN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODgwNjcxMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Xavier Lombard is a world-weary private eye in London, in exile from his native Paris; his best friend is Nathalie, a high-class call girl. He gets a call from an old friend from the Paris police department, now a businessman whose b","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0144286/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"angelwild18"},"dateCreated":"2007-04-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"An excellent "Flic" - French Cop-Style Thriller","reviewBody":"I just watched this film on DVD, and sought it out because I love Daniel Auteil's acting.

This film felt very French to me in its cinematography and overall styling, although largely London based, and shot mainly in English. 

The acting throughout was excellent, perhaps with the exception of Ciaran Hinds' Brazilian/American/Irish accent! Ciaran plays the lost son's brother in law, who brings Lombard, the French private detective living in London, in to try to solve the case of the disappearance.

The film does deal with a very sensitive subject, but I felt it did so sensitively, showing how an empire can be brought down by one man, if he feels strongly enough to sacrifice everything he has.

There are some very violent scenes, and they are wholly central to the script, highlighting how low Lombard's character, is brought by his passion and anger at what horrors he has uncovered in a paedophile ring, involved in the disappearance of the lost son. Lombard makes moral decisions throughout the film that are understandable and I feel that this is a very powerful film.

The late Katrin Cartlidge puts in a very strong performance, supporting Lombard's character in his ultimate revenge plot. Lombard's "tart with a heart" best friend, Marianne Denicourt, is excellent in a stunning bitter-sweet role, and Billie Whitelaw is fabulous as the stern, businesslike matriarch, whose lost son is being sought by Lombard, and who also comes to terms with tragic loss, as Lombard also must. Auteuil, as always, is credible, beautiful and gives a very moving performance. Although it took me a few minutes to get over his English "voice"!

In my opinion, this must be one of the best international, cross-over, thrillers in recent years.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1488,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1999-04-21","keywords":"private investigator,pedophilia,boy,sexual abuse,child prostitution","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000809/","name":"Daniel Auteuil"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000176/","name":"Nastassja Kinski"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001020/","name":"Katrin Cartlidge"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0579580/","name":"Chris Menges"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103757/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028557/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103532/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0496226/","name":"Eric Leclere"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0112127/","name":"Margaret Leclere"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0590105/","name":"Mark Mills"}],"duration":"PT1H42M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Little Women
Małe potworki
Little Monsters
programme.desc:
Little Women: Directed by Greta Gerwig. With Saoirse Ronan, Emma Watson, Florence Pugh, Eliza Scanlen. Jo March reflects back and forth on her life, telling the beloved story of the March sisters - four young women, each determined to live life on her own terms." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3281548/","name":"Little Women","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2QzYTQyYzItMzAwYi00YjZlLThjNTUtNzMyMDdkYzJiNWM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Jo March reflects back and forth on her life, telling the beloved story of the March sisters - four young women, each determined to live life on her own terms.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3281548/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"scenematica"},"dateCreated":"2020-02-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Love this little cute dear 4 women","reviewBody":"What we can expect from the girl as a movie director?

Meet Greta, a great director that will make you blame The Academy for not including her as Oscar Best Director nominees. For me, IMHO, she is more entitled to get Oscar Best Director nomination than Todd Philips.

How she direct the entire cast and crew, a camera movement, a music selection, everything is amazing.

A story plot that uses forward and backward flow (a non-linear plot) packed very cleverly. It also shows how smart the use of transition in a film.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":170649,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2019-12-25","keywords":"aspiring writer,poverty,mother daughter relationship,based on novel,death of sister","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2655304729","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2VjNGY4M2ItNDhmMS00ZTVlLWEyN2EtOWRlNGZkYzMwOTBiXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2VjNGY4M2ItNDhmMS00ZTVlLWEyN2EtOWRlNGZkYzMwOTBiXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg","description":"Writer-director Greta Gerwig (Lady Bird) has crafted a Little Women that draws on both the classic novel and the writings of Louisa May Alcott, and unfolds as the author’s alter ego, Jo March, reflects back and forth on her fictional life."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1519680/","name":"Saoirse Ronan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0914612/","name":"Emma Watson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6073955/","name":"Florence Pugh"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1950086/","name":"Greta Gerwig"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0532247/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1950086/","name":"Greta Gerwig"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0017301/","name":"Louisa May Alcott"}],"duration":"PT2H15M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Nowi mieszkańcy
Nachmieter
programme.desc: Rok 1945. Niemcy opuszczają Wrocław. Jedna z mieszkających pod miastem rodzin zmuszona jest zostać kilka miesięcy dłużej, niż zakładała. W jej domu zjawia się już jednak polska grupa krewnych. Obydwa klany mają poczucie krzywdy i wzajemnie są do siebie uprzedzone.

programme.title: Hi, How Are You
programme.desc: Bezrobotny pięćdziesięcioletni Sławek (Jacek Poniedziałek) ma problem z zabiciem wolnego czasu. Mężczyzna przesiaduje w domu bądź włóczy się po osiedlu, szukając zaginionego kota. W najlepszym razie wykonuje różnego rodzaju prace zlecone mu przez żonę. Pewnego dnia Sławek poznaje tajemniczą sąsiadkę Kamilę (Maja Szopa). Kobieta zaprasza go do swojego ogrodu.

programme.title: II koncert na wiolonczelę i orkiestrę
programme.desc: Pasją okulisty Macieja Gasika jest muzyka. W trakcie jednego z koncertów mężczyzna doznaje udaru mózgu. Staje się więźniem własnego ciała. Postanawia się nie poddawać i zawalczyć o swoją godność oraz wolność. Film na podstawie prawdziwej historii. Scenariusz stworzono do koncertu wiolonczelowego Pawła Mykietyna.

programme.title: Wojowniczka
programme.desc: Cykl prezentujący wyselekcjonowany zbiór najlepszych filmów krótkometrażowych. Wiele z nich nagrodzonych zostało prestiżowymi wyróżnieniami na międzynarodowych galach i festiwalach filmowych. Każde pasmo przedstawia kilka produkcji na dany temat.

programme.title: Daniel Day-Lewis, geniusz z Hollywood
programme.desc: Opowieść o życiu osobistym i karierze jednego z najwybitniejszych aktorów w historii kina. Swoją decyzję o zarzuceniu kariery Daniel Day-Lewis ogłosił w 2017 roku, kiedy to zagrał w ostatnim filmie - 'Nici widmo'. Do tego czasu, przez ponad 30 lat występów przed kamerą, został wyróżniony trzema Oscarami.

programme.title: Bandits
Włamanie na śniadanie
Bandits
programme.desc:
Bandits: Directed by Barry Levinson. With Bruce Willis, Billy Bob Thornton, Cate Blanchett, Troy Garity. Two bank robbers fall in love with the girl they've kidnapped." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0219965/","name":"Bandits","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkyMzA3OTI3NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMjU0ODM3._V1_.jpg","description":"Two bank robbers fall in love with the girl they've kidnapped.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0219965/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Boyo-2"},"dateCreated":"2003-04-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Entertaining Comedy","reviewBody":"Fun but no great shakes. Not the best of Barry Levinson's movies but certainly not the worse either.

Billy Bob Thornton is hysterical as Bruce Willis' partner in crime. Their method of bank robbery is rather considerate, all things considered, and kind of touching. They visit the bank president the night before and get in with his cooperation. Why this happens without incident is anyone's guess, but I don't think its supposed to be deep or insightful or anything, and I don't mean that it insults the audience either.

Cate Blanchett is along for the ride, eventually. She doesn't belong with them, or anyone else, but she adds a lot of fun.

Two bank robbers fall in love with the girl they've kidnapped." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0219965/","name":"Bandits","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkyMzA3OTI3NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMjU0ODM3._V1_.jpg","description":"Two bank robbers fall in love with the girl they've kidnapped.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0219965/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Boyo-2","dateCreated":"2003-04-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Entertaining Comedy","reviewBody":"Fun but no great shakes. Not the best of Barry Levinson's movies but certainly not the worse either.

Billy Bob Thornton is hysterical as Bruce Willis' partner in crime. Their method of bank robbery is rather considerate, all things considered, and kind of touching. They visit the bank president the night before and get in with his cooperation. Why this happens without incident is anyone's guess, but I don't think its supposed to be deep or insightful or anything, and I don't mean that it insults the audience either.

Cate Blanchett is along for the ride, eventually. She doesn't belong with them, or anyone else, but she adds a lot of fun.

I'd rate Billy Bob's hypochondriac in this alongside Woody Allen's in "Hannah And Her Sisters". 7/10.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":67263,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2001-10-12","keywords":"cousin cousin relationship,reference to bonnie tyler,escape from prison,television star,home invasion","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2371337753","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA4MWRjMTktOTIwNC00ZjczLTkwNDgtNzk4MDdjOTU5NWZiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA4MWRjMTktOTIwNC00ZjczLTkwNDgtNzk4MDdjOTU5NWZiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two bank robbers fall in love with the girl they've kidnapped.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000246/","name":"Bruce Willis","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000671/","name":"Billy Bob Thornton","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000949/","name":"Cate Blanchett"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001469/","name":"Barry Levinson"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007143/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0036225/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022018/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0679037/","name":"Harley Peyton"],"duration":"PT2H3M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Eye
Niebo nad Paryżem
Paris
programme.desc:
The Eye: Directed by David Moreau, Xavier Palud. With Jessica Alba, Alessandro Nivola, Parker Posey, Rade Serbedzija. Violinist Sydney Wells was accidentally blinded by her sister Helen when she was five years old. She submits to a cornea transplantation, and while recovering from the operation, she realizes that she is seeing dead people." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0406759/","name":"The Eye","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjczYmJhNjUtOTdmYi00MzZlLWEzOWYtNzA1ZGZjMjkwY2YyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Violinist Sydney Wells was accidentally blinded by her sister Helen when she was five years old. She submits to a cornea transplantation, and while recovering from the operation, she realizes that she is seeing dead people.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0406759/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"grangers-1"},"dateCreated":"2008-03-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Alba reminds us that you may want to check where that donated organ came from.","reviewBody":"Jessica Alba plays a woman who undergoes cornea transplants in a remake of a Chinese film of the same name.

The moment she opens her eyes she starts to see things that aren't there. These include (a) a number of grim reapers, (b) recently dead people, (c) vivid images of someone else's past premonitions, and (d) a director and editor who aren't sure whether their making a horror film, thriller or a 'who dunnit?'.

There is a faint oriental air to the film with does add a bit of mystery. This is essentially a relatively cheaply made Alba-vehicle. There is no-one else in it other than a periodically appearing sister and a doctor who you never quite get interested in as he has nothing of worth to say.

You do jump from minor shock every now and then (but then an unexpected rapid orchestral crescendo does that to most people).

The film is similar in feel to Sarah Michelle-Gellar's The Grudge. You are left with a similar feeling when you leave the cinema; a resigned "it was okay".","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":52917,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2008-10-29","keywords":"corneal transplant,eye,violinist,eye transplant,seeing dead people","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Eye","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi263323929","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM1MzAyNzkxM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzA4ODYzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM1MzAyNzkxM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzA4ODYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Eye Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004695/","name":"Jessica Alba"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005273/","name":"Alessandro Nivola"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000205/","name":"Parker Posey"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1219963/","name":"David Moreau"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0658837/","name":"Xavier Palud"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0173285/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0179341/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0012382/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0349406/","name":"Sebastian Gutierrez"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1040327/","name":"Yuet-Jan Hui"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0161152/","name":"Oxide Chun Pang"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Dressmaker
Garderobiany
The Dresser
programme.desc:
The Dressmaker: Directed by Jocelyn Moorhouse. With Kate Winslet, Judy Davis, Liam Hemsworth, Hugo Weaving. A glamorous woman returns to her small town in rural Australia. With her sewing machine and haute couture style, she transforms the women and exacts sweet revenge on those who did her wrong." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2910904/","name":"The Dressmaker","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA4MzAxNTc5OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjgzMDE4OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A glamorous woman returns to her small town in rural Australia. With her sewing machine and haute couture style, she transforms the women and exacts sweet revenge on those who did her wrong.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2910904/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mlaimlai2"},"dateCreated":"2015-11-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"All dressed up with somewhere to go!","reviewBody":"Over the years there have been many quirky, eccentric characters featured in Australian films such as Muriel's Wedding, The Castle and Priscilla Queen of the Desert. The stories have been uniquely Australian to be appreciated by Australian audiences but occasionally they become worldwide hits like Crocodile Dundee. It's the laid-back Aussie humour that international audiences sometimes just don't understand which prevents the majority of Australian films from crossing the cultural barrier. The Dressmaker has been successful at the Australian box office for it features a story where the underdog or misunderstood succeeds along with a story that promotes the Aussie dry wit with dialogue that appeals to the everyday Australian.

Myrtle 'Tilly' Dunnage (Kate Winslet) returns home to rural Australia after spending time abroad developing her fashion designing skills. As a child she was sent to a boarding school in Melbourne by Sergeant Farrat (Hugo Weaving) for she was accused of murdering a boy who bullied her. Her mother, Molly (Judy Davis) initially doesn't recognise her and isn't convinced she's her daughter. She eventually accepts her in her house and Tilly transforms it into a fashion factory where she makes clothes for the women of the town. In the meantime, she becomes romantically involved with Teddy McSwiney (Liam Hemsworth) whom she has known since they were children. The town still hasn't forgiven her for apparently killing the boy and believe she is cursed. Tilly will virtually stop at nothing to exact revenge on those who did her wrong. 

The Dressmaker is a long way from being perfect but what it does offer is an entertaining two hours that is well-paced and beguiling. There might be a few too many flashbacks and slow motion sequences but the compelling storyline featuring a wide range of interesting characters allows the majority of the film to shine. Some of the depictions of the characters might be broad but that's just the perfect fit for quintessential Australians. 

A lot of the dialogue is witty and adds much to the Aussie humour on show. Davis garners most of the laughs in a performance which demonstrates her sensational acting ability. Winslet perfects the Aussie accent with this being her second time playing an Australian after 1999's Holy Smoke! Many of the scenes she shares with her screen mother are hilarious. Weaving also has his turn in the spotlight with a wonderful performance as the cross-dressing police officer. Hemsworth plays it straight in comparison to his co-stars and reliably fulfills his role as the love interest. Support actors such as Shane Bourne, Sarah Snook, Kerry Fox and Barry Otto also succeed in projecting the individual traits of their characters.

Credit must go to the costume designs with the haute couture style befitting of the movie title. With the story being reminiscent of a Clint Eastwood western where the main character comes to town, mingles with the locals then affects their lives one way or another, the music score by David Hirschfelder has some resemblance to a western. It's an exciting score that perfectly sets up the moods of the characters and the theme of the plot. The cinematography by Donald McAlpine also enhances the look of the film, ensuring that the rural town maintains its 'western' appearance.

Although clichés do affect the characters and story, the overall quality of the film ensures that most viewers will be entertained. Jocelyn Moorhouse (the director and co-writer) should be chuffed with her film's box office success even though not all critics have praised her work. Sometimes it's the majority you have to please, not the minority. http://mlaimlai2.wix.com/magical-movie-review","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":57808,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2015-10-29","keywords":"f rated,australia,costume designer,haute couture,femme fatale","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Dressmaker trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2284565273","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkzNjU0NTAyOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTk1NjU3NjE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkzNjU0NTAyOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTk1NjU3NjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Dressmaker trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000701/","name":"Kate Winslet"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001114/","name":"Judy Davis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2955013/","name":"Liam Hemsworth"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0602104/","name":"Jocelyn Moorhouse"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0234956/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0481969/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0263798/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5672426/","name":"Rosalie Ham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0602104/","name":"Jocelyn Moorhouse"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0389591/","name":"P.J. Hogan"}],"duration":"PT1H59M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Salisbury Poisonings
The Salisbury Poisonings

The Salisbury Poisonings
programme.desc:
The Salisbury Poisonings: With Rafe Spall, Anne-Marie Duff, Annabel Scholey, Judah Cousin. Three episode, fact based drama from the BBC, about the 2018 Novichok poisoning crisis in the city of Salisbury." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt10394886/","name":"The Salisbury Poisonings","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTFiM2JjMzktZGY0Ny00ODFkLWJlYTEtNTM3N2RlMDE3YmQxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc3MjQzNTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three episode, fact based drama from the BBC, about the 2018 Novichok poisoning crisis in the city of Salisbury.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10394886/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"neilleacy"},"dateCreated":"2020-06-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"An insight into what want on behind the headlines.","reviewBody":"I know from local newspaper articles that many people in Salisbury felt that the showing of this docu-drama was too soon after the event. That it would rake over old coals and put our city once again in a bad light. We'll for me it didn't.

For those looking for a hard-hitting insight into how and why the Russians attempted what they did or why the suspects have never been charged then go watch the news specials that came out at the time. But for a view of how the real people at the heart of this whole affair were really affected then the writers, directors and actors have done a good job.

Yes, it is low key in its look and feel. Yes, there are a lot of people who know Salisbury thinking 'that's not somewhere I recognise'; the use of locations from other cathedral cities threw me off the narrative a couple of times wondering where the characters were meant to be. But most importantly it drew me in to understanding more of how just frightening the possible outcome of not having an early intervention could have been and the emotional strain on those key families.

For you 1 star reviewers I say your expectations were skewed from the start. It was good to see what felt like a truthful docu-drama.

And as my son said at the end of part 3, 'well, that was emotional.'","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4401,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama","History","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-06-14","keywords":"poisoning,salisbury wiltshire,year 2018,nerve agent,british police","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1245863/","name":"Rafe Spall"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0240359/","name":"Anne-Marie Duff"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2118257/","name":"Annabel Scholey"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0645108/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043107/"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2779562265","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzNlNGI3NzMtZDRkMC00MjdkLTgwYTUtY2ViZDcwYjJlMDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzNlNGI3NzMtZDRkMC00MjdkLTgwYTUtY2ViZDcwYjJlMDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"In March 2018, the eyes of the world turned to the British city of Salisbury when it became the epicenter of what has been described as one of the biggest political events of the 21st century -- but until now, the heroic acts behind the headlines have not been told. Within three days of the assassination attempt on double agent and spy Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia, key agencies discovered that a lethal nerve agent called Novichok was used, just half a teaspoon of which could kill 20,000 people. Within four days, hundreds of traces were found across the city, and, just when things were finally thought to be under control, a perfume bottle containing the nerve agent was discovered, throwing the investigation into renewed chaos."}}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 10394886, Title: The Salisbury Poisonings, --- Description: The Salisbury Poisonings: With Rafe Spall, Anne-Marie Duff, Annabel Scholey, Judah Cousin. Three episode, fact based drama from the BBC, about the 2018 Novichok poisoning crisis in the city of Salisbury." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt10394886/","name":"The Salisbury Poisonings","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTFiM2JjMzktZGY0Ny00ODFkLWJlYTEtNTM3N2RlMDE3YmQxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc3MjQzNTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three episode, fact based drama from the BBC, about the 2018 Novichok poisoning crisis in the city of Salisbury.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10394886/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"neilleacy","dateCreated":"2020-06-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"An insight into what want on behind the headlines.","reviewBody":"I know from local newspaper articles that many people in Salisbury felt that the showing of this docu-drama was too soon after the event. That it would rake over old coals and put our city once again in a bad light. We'll for me it didn't.

For those looking for a hard-hitting insight into how and why the Russians attempted what they did or why the suspects have never been charged then go watch the news specials that came out at the time. But for a view of how the real people at the heart of this whole affair were really affected then the writers, directors and actors have done a good job.

Yes, it is low key in its look and feel. Yes, there are a lot of people who know Salisbury thinking 'that's not somewhere I recognise'; the use of locations from other cathedral cities threw me off the narrative a couple of times wondering where the characters were meant to be. But most importantly it drew me in to understanding more of how just frightening the possible outcome of not having an early intervention could have been and the emotional strain on those key families.

For you 1 star reviewers I say your expectations were skewed from the start. It was good to see what felt like a truthful docu-drama.

And as my son said at the end of part 3, 'well, that was emotional.'","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4401,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama","History","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-06-14","keywords":"poisoning,salisbury wiltshire,year 2018,nerve agent,british police","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1245863/","name":"Rafe Spall","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0240359/","name":"Anne-Marie Duff","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2118257/","name":"Annabel Scholey"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0645108/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043107/"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2779562265","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzNlNGI3NzMtZDRkMC00MjdkLTgwYTUtY2ViZDcwYjJlMDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzNlNGI3NzMtZDRkMC00MjdkLTgwYTUtY2ViZDcwYjJlMDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"In March 2018, the eyes of the world turned to the British city of Salisbury when it became the epicenter of what has been described as one of the biggest political events of the 21st century -- but until now, the heroic acts behind the headlines have not been told. For those looking for a hard-hitting insight into how and why the Russians attempted what they did or why the suspects have never been charged then go watch the news specials that came out at the time. Within four days, hundreds of traces were found across the city, and, just when things were finally thought to be under control, a perfume bottle containing the nerve agent was discovered, throwing the investigation into renewed chaos."</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Cthulhu
Cthulhu
programme.desc: Cthulhu: Directed by Dan Gildark. With Jason Cottle, Casey Curran, Ethan Atkinson, Patrick McKnight. A Seattle history professor, drawn back to his estranged family on the Oregon coast to execute his late mother's estate, is reaquainted with his best friend from childhood, with whom he has a long-awaited tryst. Caught in an accelerating series of events, he discovers aspects of his father's New Age cult which take on a dangerous and apocalyptic significance." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0478126/","name":"Cthulhu","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ4NTMzMDkyMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODExNzI5MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A Seattle history professor, drawn back to his estranged family on the Oregon coast to execute his late mother's estate, is reaquainted with his best friend from childhood, with whom he has a long-awaited tryst. Caught in an accelera","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0478126/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"avfanatic"},"dateCreated":"2014-09-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Most Lovecraftian thing about this was that it almost drove me insane!","reviewBody":"This "movie" was terrible. The DP should be shot. They clearly spent no time on development, rehearsal, or scouting locations. That the producer sold belongings to get this movie made is profoundly sad and I hope he received treatment for whatever malady caused him to feel such fervor for this film. Uwe Boll movies MIGHT be better and they are among the worst films around. I was especially disappointed in Cara Buono's performance as I have enjoyed her work before.\n\nCharacters smile at inappropriate times for no discernible reason. Camera work to set the mood was a complete failure and annoying in its presentation. Subplots are picked up and immediately ignored. Motivations are hazy at best. No special effects to enhance the story. Absolutely nothing of Lovecraft in this movie except the title. The highlight of the film was when I sent it back to Netflix. Ugh!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2077,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Horror","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2019-12-11","keywords":"cult,shower,gay kiss,male rear nudity,drugged sex","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Cthulhu","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3067805977","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2RmMzQyM2YtMmViZS00MWU3LWE2MmItNjBiY2YyODg1M2E0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2RmMzQyM2YtMmViZS00MWU3LWE2MmItNjBiY2YyODg1M2E0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Arkham Northwest Production LLC"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0183039/","name":"Jason Cottle"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2699332/","name":"Casey Curran"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1915690/","name":"Ethan Atkinson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2031220/","name":"Dan Gildark"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0158753/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0211451/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2032953/","name":"Grant Cogswell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2031220/","name":"Dan Gildark"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0522454/","name":"H.P. programme.title: Force 10 from Navarone
Komandosi z Navarony
Force 10 from Navarone
programme.desc:
Force 10 from Navarone: Directed by Guy Hamilton. With Robert Shaw, Harrison Ford, Barbara Bach, Edward Fox. During World War II, several oddly assorted military experts are teamed in a mission to raid and destroy a bridge vital to enemy strategy." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0077572/","name":"Force 10 from Navarone","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTNjZGYyYzktMDYyOC00NDMwLTg3MGItNjU2MGQwN2I5MjlhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjUwNzk3NDc@._V1_.jpg","description":"During World War II, several oddly assorted military experts are teamed in a mission to raid and destroy a bridge vital to enemy strategy.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0077572/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"vip_ebriega"},"dateCreated":"2007-02-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"FORCE 10 FROM NAVARONE is a great yarn.","reviewBody":"My Take: Often lambasted, but fast-paced and highly entertaining sequel to the classic adventure film. 

Honestly, I think "Force 10 from Navarone" was more fast-paced, action-packed and hilarious as it's predecessor, "The Guns of Navarone", but then, it also lacks the stronger elements that made its predecessor better. But it seems unfair to compare a sequel to its predecessor when the film is a sequel in name only. Other than the opening which re-tracks the memorable final scenes from the original, FORCE 10 FROM NAVARONE mostly flies solo. 

The cast was excellent. Robert Shaw and Edward Fox are good replacements to Gregory Peck and David Niven in the roles of Keith Mallory and Major Miller. Harrison Ford absolutely amazing as Lt. Col. Barnsby. Carl Weathers is usually out of place, but he's fine enough. While Barbara Bach and Richard Kiel offer fine performances after their roles in "The Spy Who Loved Me".

There will be a few hate remarks from fans of the original, but seeing it as not a sequel to the classic film and more of a film that uses 'Guns' as its inspiration, this "sequel" is fun, exciting and occasionally excellent. 

Rating: **** out of 5.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":17665,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Drama","War"],"datePublished":"1978-12-07","keywords":"partisan,german army,collapsing bridge,booby trap,prison guard","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2111225881","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzI4NmFlYzQtM2I1YS00ZjQ5LWEyNjctMGVhOTVhZmZlOTEyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzI4NmFlYzQtM2I1YS00ZjQ5LWEyNjctMGVhOTVhZmZlOTEyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000148/","name":"Harrison Ford"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001727/","name":"Robert Shaw"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002081/","name":"Edward Fox"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0357891/","name":"Guy Hamilton"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0079398/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022781/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0533745/","name":"Alistair MacLean"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0152509/","name":"Robin Chapman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0286025/","name":"Carl Foreman"}],"duration":"PT1H58M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0077572, Title: Force 10 from Navarone, --- Description: Force 10 from Navarone: Directed by Guy Hamilton. With Robert Shaw, Harrison Ford, Barbara Bach, Edward Fox. During World War II, several oddly assorted military experts are teamed in a mission to raid and destroy a bridge vital to enemy strategy." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0077572/","name":"Force 10 from Navarone","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTNjZGYyYzktMDYyOC00NDMwLTg3MGItNjU2MGQwN2I5MjlhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjUwNzk3NDc@._V1_.jpg","description":"During World War II, several oddly assorted military experts are teamed in a mission to raid and destroy a bridge vital to enemy strategy.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0077572/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"vip_ebriega","dateCreated":"2007-02-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"FORCE 10 FROM NAVARONE is a great yarn.","reviewBody":"My Take: Often lambasted, but fast-paced and highly entertaining sequel to the classic adventure film. 

Honestly, I think "Force 10 from Navarone" was more fast-paced, action-packed and hilarious as it's predecessor, "The Guns of Navarone", but then, it also lacks the stronger elements that made its predecessor better. But it seems unfair to compare a sequel to its predecessor when the film is a sequel in name only. Other than the opening which re-tracks the memorable final scenes from the original, FORCE 10 FROM NAVARONE mostly flies solo. 

The cast was excellent. Robert Shaw and Edward Fox are good replacements to Gregory Peck and David Niven in the roles of Keith Mallory and Major Miller. Harrison Ford absolutely amazing as Lt. Col. Barnsby. Carl Weathers is usually out of place, but he's fine enough. While Barbara Bach and Richard Kiel offer fine performances after their roles in "The Spy Who Loved Me".

There will be a few hate remarks from fans of the original, but seeing it as not a sequel to the classic film and more of a film that uses 'Guns' as its inspiration, this "sequel" is fun, exciting and occasionally excellent. 

Rating: **** out of 5.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":17665,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Drama","War"],"datePublished":"1978-12-07","keywords":"partisan,german army,collapsing bridge,booby trap,prison guard","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2111225881","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzI4NmFlYzQtM2I1YS00ZjQ5LWEyNjctMGVhOTVhZmZlOTEyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzI4NmFlYzQtM2I1YS00ZjQ5LWEyNjctMGVhOTVhZmZlOTEyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000148/","name":"Harrison Ford","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001727/","name":"Robert Shaw","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002081/","name":"Edward Fox"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0357891/","name":"Guy Hamilton"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0079398/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022781/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0533745/","name":"Alistair MacLean","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0152509/","name":"Robin Chapman","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0286025/","name":"Carl Foreman"],"duration":"PT1H58M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Terminal
Koniec świata
End of the World
programme.desc:
Terminal: Directed by Vaughn Stein. With Margot Robbie, Simon Pegg, Dexter Fletcher, Mike Myers. A film noir taking place in a train terminal at night. Add 2 male assassins, female assassin, waitress, teacher, janitor and crime boss. Add revenge. Who says mystery is a lost art?" data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4463816/","name":"Terminal","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmEzOGVmNWQtZDBiMC00OTk4LTg3OWQtMzc2MzgxNjlkY2JjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"A film noir taking place in a train terminal at night. Add 2 male assassins, female assassin, waitress, teacher, janitor and crime boss. Add revenge. Who says mystery is a lost art?","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4463816/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"CANpatbuck3664"},"dateCreated":"2018-05-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"An Unbelievable Ending Makes Terminal Worth Checking Out","reviewBody":"Terminal was ripped to shreds by critics, I see why but I don't think they gave it enough credit. There's a lot of futuristic noir flourishes, the movie is bathing in neon light and seedy environments. This isn't new, its Blade Runner-esque but the cinematography is admittedly gorgeous in this. Just because it has been done before (lately with Altered Carbon and Mute) doesn't make it any less impressive. It was a nice touch and it deserves to be mentioned, even if it doesn't quite save the movie.

The plot of Terminal is very reminiscent of Guy Ritchie's movies. There's some Snatch or Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels moments but the whole movie doesn't operate as well overall. We get introduced to a bunch of seedy characters with dubious morals. They all come in and out of this train station in the middle of the night and the common thread between them is the character of Annie (Margot Robbie). She's an assassin who works part-time as a waitress and stripper. Through her comings and goings, we meet a terminally ill teacher Bill (Simon Pegg), a pair of mismatched hitmen Vince (Dexter Fletcher) and Alfred (Max Irons) and an odd janitor Clinton (Mike Myers). How these interactions play into the larger plot is a mystery to us until the final turn. The setup isn't bad, we've seen it before and although there are plot holes, none of them were bad enough to completely derail the movie. It was enough to keep me interested but I did find my attention drifting in and out because of the lack of cohesion. As a story, its very middle of the road for the genre.

Any heat for this movie was likely due to Margot Robbie's involvement as the main character. She keeps climbing the ladder and its deserved, she's great and I consider myself a fan of hers. She's good in Terminal, she's surprisingly committed, and she carries the movie capably. I do agree with some of the other reviewers in that she comes off as British Harley Quinn, but she didn't phone it in. Pegg is his typical charming self, he's very low-key in this but he works well with Robbie and I particularly enjoyed the montage that they share near the tail-end of the movie. Fletcher and Irons were odd, neither of them were terrible but Fletcher was over doing it and Irons was a little stiff. It was nice to see Mike Myers again and I think he did about as well as he could have with the material. Its a big distance from where his character starts to where he ends up and it makes his performance a little awkward by the end.

I was down the middle on Terminal for most of its run time for all the reasons listed above. It was never stellar, but it had its moments. I was more than ready to just let it float the rest of the way to whatever normal twist ending it had up its sleeve and call it a day. But when the confrontation comes between Annie and Bill, the movie doesn't just dip its toes into a pool of nonsense/crazy, it cannonballs into it. I wasn't just snickering, I was laughing when Terminal ended. Its not that the twist it takes is new, its handled in such a rough and implausible manner that I was shocked. But it didn't derail the movie for me, it actually improved it. It made Terminal memorable and while I would never say that this movie is good, its going to hold a place in my memory for insane plot twists.

I feel a little guilty for giving Terminal as high of a rating as I have. I liked the style of the movie and some of the performances (notably Robbie, Pegg and some of Myers) were solid. But it never reached high enough for something great and in any other movie, that twist ending would have knocked it down to a 3 or a 4/10. But that ending pushed the movie from mediocre to so bad its good territory for me. I can't call Terminal excellent but if you enjoy campy cinema, this is something you should see. I'm giving Terminal a 6/10 and I feel like I'm being generous.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":21313,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2018-05-11","keywords":"bare chested male bondage,tied to a bed,revenge,written by director,wager","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi671922201","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzU0Y2YwZDktYzc3Mi00ZjE3LWI3NmMtNjZiYmFlYTBlZTE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzU0Y2YwZDktYzc3Mi00ZjE3LWI3NmMtNjZiYmFlYTBlZTE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the dark heart of a sprawling, anonymous city, 'Terminal' follows the twisting tales of two assassins carrying out a sinister mission, a teacher battling a fatal illness, an enigmatic janitor and a curious waitress leading a dangerous double life. Murderous consequences unravel in the dead of night as their lives all intertwine at the hands of a mysterious criminal mastermind hell-bent on revenge."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3053338/","name":"Margot Robbie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0670408/","name":"Simon Pegg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002077/","name":"Dexter Fletcher"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2389363/","name":"Vaughn Stein"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0465725/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0482754/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0303030/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2389363/","name":"Vaughn Stein"}],"duration":"PT1H35M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Devil in a Blue Dress
W bagnie Los Angeles
Devil in a Blue Dress
programme.desc: Devil in a Blue Dress: Directed by Carl Franklin. With Denzel Washington, Tom Sizemore, Jennifer Beals, Don Cheadle. An African-American man is hired to find a woman, and gets mixed up in a murderous political scandal." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0112857/","name":"Devil in a Blue Dress","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjI3NjFiNmMtMmQ1ZC00OTUwLWJlMWMtM2UxY2M2NDQ0OWJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTI4MjkwNjA@._V1_.jpg","description":"An African-American man is hired to find a woman, and gets mixed up in a murderous political scandal.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0112857/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dfranzen70"},"dateCreated":"2000-02-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Dazzling atmosphere, Washington make this a winner","reviewBody":"Denzel Washington plays Easy Rawlins, a down-on-his-luck sometime machinist, sometime detective in late-1940's L.A. Seems someone wants him to find a mysterious white lady in a blue dress (Jennifer Beals)who's thought to have been seen in a blacks-only club. Enter Easy, who with his connections can get into the club and find the girl. But, of course, there's more to this plot than just that, or else it'd be a mighty short film.\n\n The atmosphere is a major asset here; director Carl Franklin has done a magnificent job not only of recreating the Los Angeles of the late forties but also of showing the story from the black perspective, a rarity in film. All the sights and sounds are there, and if you concentrate real hard you can even detect the smells, too. Washington's aces, of course, as usual; makes you wonder if he'll do any more adaptations of Walter Mosley books starring Easy Rawlins. He's aided by a very good supporting cast, including Beals and Tom Sizemore (playing a heavy, surprise surprise!). Fans of Washington should watch this, but really anyone who likes film noir will approve.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":19355,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"1995-09-29","keywords":"african american,jazz club,private detective,missing person,jazz music","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Devil in a Blue Dress","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi966918425","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGRlYTI0ZTktNzc0OC00NjMyLTkwODgtNTQ5YmY5YzFlZGY1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGRlYTI0ZTktNzc0OC00NjMyLTkwODgtNTQ5YmY5YzFlZGY1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Columbia Tristar"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000243/","name":"Denzel Washington"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001744/","name":"Tom Sizemore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000884/","name":"Jennifer Beals"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002083/","name":"Carl Franklin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005883/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0093046/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043058/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0608859/","name":"Walter Mosley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002083/","name":"Carl Franklin"}],"duration":"PT1H42M"}</script><metacontent="
