programme.title: Single White Female
Sublokatorka
Single White Female
programme.desc:
Single White Female: Directed by Barbet Schroeder. With Bridget Fonda, Jennifer Jason Leigh, Steven Weber, Peter Friedman. A woman advertising for a new roommate finds that something very strange is going on with the tenant who decides to move in." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0105414/","name":"Single White Female","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjNmMTNjYzEtNGIzOC00ZDc2LWFjN2UtZTNmZjgxZDJkNzBlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjQ2MjQ5NzM@._V1_.jpg","description":"A woman advertising for a new roommate finds that something very strange is going on with the tenant who decides to move in.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0105414/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"hitchcockthelegend"},"dateCreated":"2011-08-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Who needs references these days anyway?","reviewBody":"Single White Female is directed by Barbet Schroeder and adapted to screenplay by Don Roos from the novel "SWF Seeks Same" written by John Lutz. It stars Bridget Fonda, Jennifer Jason Leigh, Steven Weber, Peter Friedman and Stephen Tobolowsky. Music is by Howard Shore and cinematography by Luciano Tovoli.

When it's revealed that her partner Sam (Weber) has been cheating on her with his ex-wife, Allie Jones (Fonda) kicks him out of the apartment and advertises for a female roommate. She chooses Hedra Carlson (Leigh), who on the surface seems to be the perfect roommate. Smoothly helping Allie through her crisis, a real friendship is formed, but it's not long before Hedra starts to exhibit some dark behaviour patterns ..

The early 90s saw the "Woman from Hell" back in vogue in mainstream cinema. After the success and publicity of Fatal Attraction (1987), there was a period where you feel that sensible film makers wisely chose to let that particular film disappear from the film lovers memory banks. As it happens, they must have collectively chose 5 years as the cooling off period. For 1992 saw a wave of mad female on the loose pictures released. Led by the publicity gobbling Basic Instinct, films such as The Hand That Rocks the Cradle and Single White Female put bums on cinema seats and reopened the "Mad Bitch" sub-genre. Of the three, Single White Female grossed the least, which is strange since it's a better movie than the other two.

Schroeder's (Barfly/Reversal of Fortune) movie isn't a complete success, there's not enough development of the main characters and there's some unintentionally funny moments. But when it's good it's real good. Reeling off a number of memorable and often chilling scenes, film is further boosted by the psychological smarts in Roos' (Boys on the Side) screenplay. It helps that Schroeder has a knack for pacing, too, where he neatly simmers the plot until the spill over for the big finale. No disappointment there either, a good combination of genre staples is enhanced in impact by some unexpected character developments, and there's moments of genuine suspense to lure the viewer to the edge of their seat. 

It's also stylishly shot by Schroeder and Tovoli (Suspiria/Tenebrae). Allie's Upper West Side apartment is imposing and expansive, with high ceilings, old time plumbing, a clunky lift and a dingy laundry in the basement. It's a different set-up for such a thriller, no picket fence harmony house or beach side residence, this is bustling New York, big spaces, but as it turns out, that means no hiding place. The boys behind the cameras get the maximum they can from the locale by blending imposing and ominous with grainy veneer and filtered light. On the acting front, the girls put great effort into making their thinly developed characters work, with Leigh doing a good line in progressive instability. While Friedman, Weber and a wonderfully naughty Tobolowsky, make the most of their secondary roles. 

One or two obvious flaws aside, this still rounds out as a thoroughly enjoyable thriller. 7.5/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":35396,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1992-08-14","keywords":"female star appears nude,roommate,female nudity,bound and gagged,woman in bathtub","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2455550745","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2I0M2E4NTgtOWQ3ZC00ZGI2LWFlY2ItNjdhNTVjODBkZDE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2I0M2E4NTgtOWQ3ZC00ZGI2LWFlY2ItNjdhNTVjODBkZDE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000403/","name":"Bridget Fonda"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000492/","name":"Jennifer Jason Leigh"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001836/","name":"Steven Weber"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0775447/","name":"Barbet Schroeder"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1661375/","name":"John Lutz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0740400/","name":"Don Roos"}],"duration":"PT1H47M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Mama
programme.desc: Lilly i Victoria znikają w tajemniczych okolicznościach tuż po tym, jak ich matka zostaje zamordowana. Wujek sióstr Lucas (Nikolaj Coster-Waldau) wraz z narzeczoną Annabel (Jessica Chastain) rozpoczyna poszukiwania. Dziewczynki udaje się odnaleźć dopiero po pięciu latach. Lucas i Annabel zabierają je do siebie. Odtąd w ich domu zaczynają dziać się niepokojące rzeczy.

programme.title: Get Carter
Dorwać Cartera
Get Carter
programme.desc: Get Carter: Directed by Stephen Kay. With Sylvester Stallone, Miranda Richardson, Rachael Leigh Cook, Rhona Mitra. A Las Vegas mob enforcer travels back to his hometown to investigate his brother's mysterious death." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0208988/","name":"Get Carter","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkzMDk3Njg3NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNTIzMzU3._V1_.jpg","description":"A Las Vegas mob enforcer travels back to his hometown to investigate his brother's mysterious death.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0208988/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"thinker1691"},"dateCreated":"2011-04-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"" I'm the kind of guy your mother warned you about "","reviewBody":"In 1971, the first of these action, violence prone films was offered. In the original novel, written by Ted Lewis, it was Michael Caine who was the unstoppable, revenge filled Gangster out to discover who killed his brother. In this updated version directed by Stephen Kay, we have Sylvester Stallone playing Jack Carter. Both versions were very well conceived. The updated film has added the blood, gore and non-stop drama which is common with newer versions. The story remains the same in that Carter (Stallone) learns his younger brother died under suspicious circumstances and he is determined to learn why. Along the way, he is met with business types who are not interested in helping Carter find the truth. To that end, John C. McGinley, Mickey Rourke and even Michael Caine get in the action. The movie is filled with dark sequences, black violence and thrilling chase scenes, all of which add to the final outcome. Great movie and a worthy successor to the original. ****","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":33928,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2001-04-11","keywords":"enforcer,movie flop,cigarette,body lands on a car,character repeats someone else's dialogue","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Get Carter","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi550306585","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGFlZGQ2MTQtNDMwMS00YjFiLTk3OWItZWI1YzBhZjRmMzk2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGFlZGQ2MTQtNDMwMS00YjFiLTk3OWItZWI1YzBhZjRmMzk2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Warner Home Video"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000230/","name":"Sylvester Stallone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000337/","name":"Rachael Leigh Cook"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001669/","name":"Miranda Richardson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0443181/","name":"Stephen Kay"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033472/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043393/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052111/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0507794/","name":"Ted Lewis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0571346/","name":"David McKenna"}],"duration":"PT1H42M"}</script><metacontent="

McGinley (role=Con McCarty), Alan Cumming (role=Jeremy Kinnear), Michael Caine (role=Cliff Brumby), John Cassini (role=Thorpey), Mickey Rourke (role=Cyrus Paice), Mark Boone Junior (role=Jim Davis), Garwin Sanford (role=Les Fletcher)

IMDb data; ttnr: 0208988, Title: Get Carter, --- Description: Get Carter: Directed by Stephen Kay. With Sylvester Stallone, Miranda Richardson, Rachael Leigh Cook, Rhona Mitra. A Las Vegas mob enforcer travels back to his hometown to investigate his brother's mysterious death." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0208988/","name":"Get Carter","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkzMDk3Njg3NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNTIzMzU3._V1_.jpg","description":"A Las Vegas mob enforcer travels back to his hometown to investigate his brother's mysterious death.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0208988/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"thinker1691","dateCreated":"2011-04-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"" I'm the kind of guy your mother warned you about "","reviewBody":"In 1971, the first of these action, violence prone films was offered. In the original novel, written by Ted Lewis, it was Michael Caine who was the unstoppable, revenge filled Gangster out to discover who killed his brother. In this updated version directed by Stephen Kay, we have Sylvester Stallone playing Jack Carter. Both versions were very well conceived. The updated film has added the blood, gore and non-stop drama which is common with newer versions. The story remains the same in that Carter (Stallone) learns his younger brother died under suspicious circumstances and he is determined to learn why. Along the way, he is met with business types who are not interested in helping Carter find the truth. To that end, John C. McGinley, Mickey Rourke and even Michael Caine get in the action. The movie is filled with dark sequences, black violence and thrilling chase scenes, all of which add to the final outcome. Great movie and a worthy successor to the original. ****","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":33928,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.2,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2001-04-11","keywords":"enforcer,movie flop,cigarette,body lands on a car,character repeats someone else's dialogue","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Get Carter","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi550306585","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGFlZGQ2MTQtNDMwMS00YjFiLTk3OWItZWI1YzBhZjRmMzk2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGFlZGQ2MTQtNDMwMS00YjFiLTk3OWItZWI1YzBhZjRmMzk2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Warner Home Video","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000230/","name":"Sylvester Stallone","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000337/","name":"Rachael Leigh Cook","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001669/","name":"Miranda Richardson"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0443181/","name":"Stephen Kay"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033472/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043393/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052111/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0507794/","name":"Ted Lewis","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0571346/","name":"David McKenna"],"duration":"PT1H42M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Snatch
Przekręt
Snatch.
programme.desc:
Snatch: Directed by Guy Ritchie. With Ade, William Beck, Andy Beckwith, Ewen Bremner. Unscrupulous boxing promoters, violent bookmakers, a Russian gangster, incompetent amateur robbers and supposedly Jewish jewelers fight to track down a priceless stolen diamond." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0208092/","name":"Snatch","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTA2NDYxOGYtYjU1Mi00Y2QzLTgxMTQtMWI1MGI0ZGQ5MmU4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDk3NzU2MTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Unscrupulous boxing promoters, violent bookmakers, a Russian gangster, incompetent amateur robbers and supposedly Jewish jewelers fight to track down a priceless stolen diamond.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0208092/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"FilmOtaku"},"dateCreated":"2004-08-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"There are few films that can make me laugh like this one can","reviewBody":"`Snatch', written and directed by Guy Ritchie is by far one of my favorite films of all time  it is easily in my personal Top Thirty. In the film, about (what else?) several schemes that happen to go very wrong yet manage to intertwine and (for better or worse) resolve themselves in the end, Ritchie assembles one of the funniest cast of characters in recent memory. Let's see if we can keep this straight:

Turkish (Jason Statham) and his partner Tommy (Stephen Graham) are amateur boxing promoters who, after their premier fighter is wounded, have to find a replacement to fight, or one of the meanest guys in London, Brick Top (Alan Ford), who just happens to run the boxing matches and stands to make a lot of money off of the fight is going to impart his unique brand of justice on them. Enter Mickey (Brad Pitt) the gypsy who knocked their fighter out, who is an unintelligible drunk with quite a right hook. Meanwhile, there is a diamond `the size of a fist' that has been stolen by Franky Four Fingers (Benicio Del Toro). On his way back from London to America where he is planning on fencing the diamond, trouble ensues, and his fence, Cousin Avi (Dennis Farina) is forced to come to London to find both Franky and the diamond with the help of characters like Bullet Tooth Tony (Vinnie Jones) and Doug `The Head' Denovitz (Mike Reid). Of course, this can't happen easily, as there are a trio of inept thieves on the trail of the diamond as well as my personal favorite character in the film, Boris `The Blade' Yurinov (Rade Serbedzija)  or as he's better known, `Boris the Bullet Dodger'. 

Did you get all that? The performances by all of the above actors, and several more that I didn't even mention are all really good, particularly Brad Pitt's. Every single actor in `Snatch' looks like they are having one hell of a good time working in the film. This story, while complex and with many ramifications from the core plot is absolutely brilliant and a lot of fun. There are many one-liners that I still personally use four years after first seeing the film, and the intricate weaving of the characters to tell a very simple heist story is just SO good. `Snatch' would be a great film due to its story alone, but Guy Ritchie's direction is so dead on, the film transcends brilliant and becomes FAN-insert your choice of expletive here-TASTIC. The slick cinematography, lightning-fast pacing and fun camera angles are right on target with the story. Add on a great soundtrack that spans Oasis, techno and a traditional-sounding Hasidic song and Ritchie has presented the viewer with an instant classic. 

While this was not the first time I had seen the film `Snatch', it was the first time I'd watched the film knowing that I would have to analyze it slightly in order to funnel my thoughts from the film just being `Phenomenal!' to `Phenomenal because ..' While I can certainly be classified as an unabashed Madonna fan, and have been for the last two decades, I REALLY hope that Ritchie decides to drop his wife from his film work and not continue on the `Swept Away' path, rather, to get back to the work that has earned him well-deserved high praise. Sorry Madge.

--Shelly","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":819272,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2000-09-01","keywords":"diamond,boxer,narrated by character,fight,boxing","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Snatch","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1558577433","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGU4YzdkNmQtMjJjMS00MDA4LTkwYWUtYjNiNDNhMDMzZDcwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGU4YzdkNmQtMjJjMS00MDA4LTkwYWUtYjNiNDNhMDMzZDcwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Screen Gems"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005458/","name":"Jason Statham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000093/","name":"Brad Pitt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0334318/","name":"Stephen Graham"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005363/","name":"Guy Ritchie"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000750/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005363/","name":"Guy Ritchie"}],"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Sneakers
Włamywacze
Sneakers
programme.desc:
Sneakers: Directed by Phil Alden Robinson. With Jo Marr, Gary Hershberger, Robert Redford, Sidney Poitier. A security pro finds his past coming back to haunt him, when he and his unique team are tasked with retrieving a particularly important item." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0105435/","name":"Sneakers","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTg0MTU0Y2YtNWEyNC00NDU3LWJhNjYtZGIzMWI0YWMwMTdhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjMwMjk0MTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A security pro finds his past coming back to haunt him, when he and his unique team are tasked with retrieving a particularly important item.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0105435/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"treeskier802"},"dateCreated":"2007-06-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Light-Hearted Caper Film","reviewBody":"I was drawn to Sneakers because I heard the story was of my favorite genre, a spy thriller. However, I found this movie to be more along the lines of a caper film.

Robert Redford is the leader of a team of experts who break into security systems so that institutions (such as banks) can see how good their system is. The team is made up of a diverse group: an ex-Cia agent (Portier) and three computer whizzes (Ackroyd, Phoenix, and the blind Stratharn). The group has great chemistry and often this leads to some fun humor.

Redford and his team are hired by the government (so they believe) to retrieve a black box that can decode encrypted computer firewalls. After retrieving the black box, the team finds themselves in dire trouble. 

I was hoping the film would be more intense, yet Sneakers incorporates a lot of humor. It is a fun film and is enjoyable to watch, but if you are looking for a true spy film, then you may want to pass.

This film more closely resembles recent movies like Ocean's 11 or The Italian Job, popcorn films that have some laughs, some danger, and some suspense.

Redford is really great in this movie as is Straitarn; Mary McDonnell is also very good. Phoenix holds his own. Although far from their best roles, Poitier, James Earl Jones, Ackroyd, and Ben Kingsley are decent.

Overall an enjoyable film which incorporates computer hacking before it was mainstream. Rating 7 of 10 stars.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":57027,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"1992-09-11","keywords":"computer,cryptography,security,nsa,encryption","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Sneakers","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi931725593","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjEzNGU0NzEtMzFlOC00OWYwLWFmZWUtYWVlOWEzNTI5MDk4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjEzNGU0NzEtMzFlOC00OWYwLWFmZWUtYWVlOWEzNTI5MDk4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Universal Studios Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000602/","name":"Robert Redford"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000101/","name":"Dan Aykroyd"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001627/","name":"Sidney Poitier"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004675/","name":"Phil Alden Robinson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009384/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004675/","name":"Phil Alden Robinson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0489623/","name":"Lawrence Lasker"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0662748/","name":"Walter F. programme.title: Dark Horse
Czarny koń
Dark Horse
programme.desc: Dark Horse: Directed by Todd Solondz. With Melisa Young, Jordan Gelber, Selma Blair, Mia Farrow. Romance blooms between two tricenarians in arrested development: an avid toy collector who is the dark horse of his family and a depressed woman on the rebound." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1690455/","name":"Dark Horse","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjI5MDNjMDgtYjRlNy00ZGEyLWI3OTItZWIxYTcyY2FhNGU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxMTY0OTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Romance blooms between two tricenarians in arrested development: an avid toy collector who is the dark horse of his family and a depressed woman on the rebound.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1690455/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"MOscarbradley"},"dateCreated":"2013-04-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Funny peculiar rather than funny ha-ha!","reviewBody":"Todd Solondz obviously doesn't like people. If he did he wouldn't give us characters as thoroughly unlikable as Abe and Miranda, make them the leads in his disquieting, fantasy 'rom-com' "Dark Horse" and then set them up for our ridicule, (the 'comedy' comes from how much we laugh at these characters rather than with them). Abe is fat, unattractive and obnoxious with it and Jordan Gelber plays him superbly. Miranda is a would-be beauty who has let herself go; let herself go to the extent that she is prepared to marry Abe, a man she doesn't even like let alone love. Selma Blair plays her as a one-dimensional loser making her equally difficult to like. Abe lives at home with his parents, (brilliant performances from Christopher Walken and Mia Farrow), and works for his dad, though to be honest he doesn't do much work.\n\nThis is typical Solondz; a miserablist, myopic vision of humanity but without the brilliance that distinguished earlier pictures like "Welcome to the Dollhouse" and "Happiness". If I describe this as a 'pathetic' picture I don't mean that it's bad. It's very well written, directed and acted, (Donna Murphy is terrific as the secretary who fuels Abe's fantasies), but it's full of people you would cross town, never mind the street, to avoid and whatever handicaps you might have yourself it makes you glad you're not like anyone up there on the screen.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5933,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2012-06-29","keywords":"hepatitis b,man wrapped in a towel,collectible,theater poster,poster","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi516268569","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTkyNjU2MTgxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDgwMTcyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTkyNjU2MTgxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDgwMTcyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Romance blooms between two thirty-somethings in arrested development: an avid toy collector who lives with his parents and a woman who is the dark horse of her family. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0312217/","name":"Jordan Gelber"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004757/","name":"Selma Blair"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000686/","name":"Christopher Walken"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001754/","name":"Todd Solondz"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0316179/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001754/","name":"Todd Solondz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0543283/","name":"Harold Manning"}],"duration":"PT1H26M"}</script><metacontent="

If he did he wouldn't give us characters as thoroughly unlikable as Abe and Miranda, make them the leads in his disquieting, fantasy 'rom-com' "Dark Horse" and then set them up for our ridicule, (the 'comedy' comes from how much we laugh at these characters rather than with them). Abe is fat, unattractive and obnoxious with it and Jordan Gelber plays him superbly. Miranda is a would-be beauty who has let herself go; let herself go to the extent that she is prepared to marry Abe, a man she doesn't even like let alone love. Selma Blair plays her as a one-dimensional loser making her equally difficult to like. Abe lives at home with his parents, (brilliant performances from Christopher Walken and Mia Farrow), and works for his dad, though to be honest he doesn't do much work.\n\nThis is typical Solondz; a miserablist, myopic vision of humanity but without the brilliance that distinguished earlier pictures like "Welcome to the Dollhouse" and "Happiness". If I describe this as a 'pathetic' picture I don't mean that it's bad. It's very well written, directed and acted, (Donna Murphy is terrific as the secretary who fuels Abe's fantasies), but it's full of people you would cross town, never mind the street, to avoid and whatever handicaps you might have yourself it makes you glad you're not like anyone up there on the screen.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5933,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9,"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2012-06-29","keywords":"hepatitis b,man wrapped in a towel,collectible,theater poster,poster","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi516268569","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTkyNjU2MTgxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDgwMTcyMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTkyNjU2MTgxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDgwMTcyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Romance blooms between two thirty-somethings in arrested development: an avid toy collector who lives with his parents and a woman who is the dark horse of her family. programme.title: Halloween: The Curse of Michael Myers
Halloween 6: Przekleństwo Michaela Myersa
Halloween: The Curse of Michael Myers
programme.desc:
Halloween: The Curse of Michael Myers: Directed by Joe Chappelle. With Donald Pleasence, Paul Rudd, Marianne Hagan, Mitchell Ryan. Six years after Michael Myers last terrorized Haddonfield, he returns there in pursuit of his niece, Jamie Lloyd, who has escaped with her newborn child, for which Michael and a mysterious cult have sinister plans." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0113253/","name":"Halloween: The Curse of Michael Myers","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzQ3MjgzMWMtMjJhMy00MmVjLTllMzMtMWVjMmMxNTIzNWQ0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Six years after Michael Myers last terrorized Haddonfield, he returns there in pursuit of his niece, Jamie Lloyd, who has escaped with her newborn child, for which Michael and a mysterious cult have sinister plans.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0113253/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Sleepin_Dragon"},"dateCreated":"2018-10-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not as bad as people make out.","reviewBody":"By this stage the franchise had really gotten tired, the previous few had been very poor, almost an insult to the fabulous original.

Of the first six films I would place this third overall, after one and two. It doesn't deserve its reputation as a bad film, because it isn't bad, nor is it great.

On the plus side, it has some scary moments, Michael's character is well used. The acting in general is rather good, it's quite slick, in a nineties way. On the debit side, the story is a little far fetched, and I didn't particularly like the cult element, it's like they tried to rewrite the show's past. It's a bit silly I guess, but....

At least it has Paul Rudd and the wonderful Donald Pleasance.

Not that bad. 6/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":35067,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1995-09-29","keywords":"halloween,slasher,hospital,knife,occult","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Halloween 6: The Curse of Michael Myers","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1391435289","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2EyZjNiMDEtZTk5NC00YzBlLTllY2MtYzdhYWFhNzNmYWZkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2EyZjNiMDEtZTk5NC00YzBlLTllY2MtYzdhYWFhNzNmYWZkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Miramax"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000587/","name":"Donald Pleasence"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0748620/","name":"Paul Rudd"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0353238/","name":"Marianne Hagan"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0152640/","name":"Joe Chappelle"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0756494/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022594/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0091393/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0384185/","name":"Debra Hill"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000118/","name":"John Carpenter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0268107/","name":"Daniel Farrands"}],"duration":"PT1H27M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Terminal
Koniec świata
End of the World
programme.desc:
Terminal: Directed by Vaughn Stein. With Margot Robbie, Simon Pegg, Dexter Fletcher, Mike Myers. A film noir taking place in a train terminal at night. Add 2 male assassins, female assassin, waitress, teacher, janitor and crime boss. Add revenge. Who says mystery is a lost art?" data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4463816/","name":"Terminal","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmEzOGVmNWQtZDBiMC00OTk4LTg3OWQtMzc2MzgxNjlkY2JjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"A film noir taking place in a train terminal at night. Add 2 male assassins, female assassin, waitress, teacher, janitor and crime boss. Add revenge. Who says mystery is a lost art?","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4463816/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"CANpatbuck3664"},"dateCreated":"2018-05-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"An Unbelievable Ending Makes Terminal Worth Checking Out","reviewBody":"Terminal was ripped to shreds by critics, I see why but I don't think they gave it enough credit. There's a lot of futuristic noir flourishes, the movie is bathing in neon light and seedy environments. This isn't new, its Blade Runner-esque but the cinematography is admittedly gorgeous in this. Just because it has been done before (lately with Altered Carbon and Mute) doesn't make it any less impressive. It was a nice touch and it deserves to be mentioned, even if it doesn't quite save the movie.

The plot of Terminal is very reminiscent of Guy Ritchie's movies. There's some Snatch or Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels moments but the whole movie doesn't operate as well overall. We get introduced to a bunch of seedy characters with dubious morals. They all come in and out of this train station in the middle of the night and the common thread between them is the character of Annie (Margot Robbie). She's an assassin who works part-time as a waitress and stripper. Through her comings and goings, we meet a terminally ill teacher Bill (Simon Pegg), a pair of mismatched hitmen Vince (Dexter Fletcher) and Alfred (Max Irons) and an odd janitor Clinton (Mike Myers). How these interactions play into the larger plot is a mystery to us until the final turn. The setup isn't bad, we've seen it before and although there are plot holes, none of them were bad enough to completely derail the movie. It was enough to keep me interested but I did find my attention drifting in and out because of the lack of cohesion. As a story, its very middle of the road for the genre.

Any heat for this movie was likely due to Margot Robbie's involvement as the main character. She keeps climbing the ladder and its deserved, she's great and I consider myself a fan of hers. She's good in Terminal, she's surprisingly committed, and she carries the movie capably. I do agree with some of the other reviewers in that she comes off as British Harley Quinn, but she didn't phone it in. Pegg is his typical charming self, he's very low-key in this but he works well with Robbie and I particularly enjoyed the montage that they share near the tail-end of the movie. Fletcher and Irons were odd, neither of them were terrible but Fletcher was over doing it and Irons was a little stiff. It was nice to see Mike Myers again and I think he did about as well as he could have with the material. Its a big distance from where his character starts to where he ends up and it makes his performance a little awkward by the end.

I was down the middle on Terminal for most of its run time for all the reasons listed above. It was never stellar, but it had its moments. I was more than ready to just let it float the rest of the way to whatever normal twist ending it had up its sleeve and call it a day. But when the confrontation comes between Annie and Bill, the movie doesn't just dip its toes into a pool of nonsense/crazy, it cannonballs into it. I wasn't just snickering, I was laughing when Terminal ended. Its not that the twist it takes is new, its handled in such a rough and implausible manner that I was shocked. But it didn't derail the movie for me, it actually improved it. It made Terminal memorable and while I would never say that this movie is good, its going to hold a place in my memory for insane plot twists.

I feel a little guilty for giving Terminal as high of a rating as I have. I liked the style of the movie and some of the performances (notably Robbie, Pegg and some of Myers) were solid. But it never reached high enough for something great and in any other movie, that twist ending would have knocked it down to a 3 or a 4/10. But that ending pushed the movie from mediocre to so bad its good territory for me. I can't call Terminal excellent but if you enjoy campy cinema, this is something you should see. I'm giving Terminal a 6/10 and I feel like I'm being generous.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":21313,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2018-05-11","keywords":"bare chested male bondage,tied to a bed,revenge,written by director,wager","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi671922201","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzU0Y2YwZDktYzc3Mi00ZjE3LWI3NmMtNjZiYmFlYTBlZTE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzU0Y2YwZDktYzc3Mi00ZjE3LWI3NmMtNjZiYmFlYTBlZTE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the dark heart of a sprawling, anonymous city, 'Terminal' follows the twisting tales of two assassins carrying out a sinister mission, a teacher battling a fatal illness, an enigmatic janitor and a curious waitress leading a dangerous double life. Murderous consequences unravel in the dead of night as their lives all intertwine at the hands of a mysterious criminal mastermind hell-bent on revenge."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3053338/","name":"Margot Robbie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0670408/","name":"Simon Pegg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002077/","name":"Dexter Fletcher"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2389363/","name":"Vaughn Stein"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0465725/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0482754/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0303030/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2389363/","name":"Vaughn Stein"}],"duration":"PT1H35M"}</script><metacontent="

credits.actor: Jhey Castles, Joseph Michael Harris, Evan James Henderson, Jacqueline Scislowski, Sallieu Sesay, Remy O'Brien, Steve Dellatori, Sharon Desiree, Crash Buist

Who says mystery is a lost art?" data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4463816/","name":"Terminal","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmEzOGVmNWQtZDBiMC00OTk4LTg3OWQtMzc2MzgxNjlkY2JjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"A film noir taking place in a train terminal at night. Add 2 male assassins, female assassin, waitress, teacher, janitor and crime boss. Add revenge. Who says mystery is a lost art?","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4463816/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"CANpatbuck3664","dateCreated":"2018-05-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"An Unbelievable Ending Makes Terminal Worth Checking Out","reviewBody":"Terminal was ripped to shreds by critics, I see why but I don't think they gave it enough credit. There's a lot of futuristic noir flourishes, the movie is bathing in neon light and seedy environments. This isn't new, its Blade Runner-esque but the cinematography is admittedly gorgeous in this. Just because it has been done before (lately with Altered Carbon and Mute) doesn't make it any less impressive. It was a nice touch and it deserves to be mentioned, even if it doesn't quite save the movie.

The plot of Terminal is very reminiscent of Guy Ritchie's movies. There's some Snatch or Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels moments but the whole movie doesn't operate as well overall. We get introduced to a bunch of seedy characters with dubious morals. They all come in and out of this train station in the middle of the night and the common thread between them is the character of Annie (Margot Robbie). She's an assassin who works part-time as a waitress and stripper. Through her comings and goings, we meet a terminally ill teacher Bill (Simon Pegg), a pair of mismatched hitmen Vince (Dexter Fletcher) and Alfred (Max Irons) and an odd janitor Clinton (Mike Myers). How these interactions play into the larger plot is a mystery to us until the final turn. The setup isn't bad, we've seen it before and although there are plot holes, none of them were bad enough to completely derail the movie. It was enough to keep me interested but I did find my attention drifting in and out because of the lack of cohesion. As a story, its very middle of the road for the genre.

Any heat for this movie was likely due to Margot Robbie's involvement as the main character. She keeps climbing the ladder and its deserved, she's great and I consider myself a fan of hers. She's good in Terminal, she's surprisingly committed, and she carries the movie capably. I do agree with some of the other reviewers in that she comes off as British Harley Quinn, but she didn't phone it in. Pegg is his typical charming self, he's very low-key in this but he works well with Robbie and I particularly enjoyed the montage that they share near the tail-end of the movie. Fletcher and Irons were odd, neither of them were terrible but Fletcher was over doing it and Irons was a little stiff. It was nice to see Mike Myers again and I think he did about as well as he could have with the material. Its a big distance from where his character starts to where he ends up and it makes his performance a little awkward by the end.

I was down the middle on Terminal for most of its run time for all the reasons listed above. It was never stellar, but it had its moments. I was more than ready to just let it float the rest of the way to whatever normal twist ending it had up its sleeve and call it a day. But when the confrontation comes between Annie and Bill, the movie doesn't just dip its toes into a pool of nonsense/crazy, it cannonballs into it. I wasn't just snickering, I was laughing when Terminal ended. Its not that the twist it takes is new, its handled in such a rough and implausible manner that I was shocked. But it didn't derail the movie for me, it actually improved it. It made Terminal memorable and while I would never say that this movie is good, its going to hold a place in my memory for insane plot twists.

I feel a little guilty for giving Terminal as high of a rating as I have. I liked the style of the movie and some of the performances (notably Robbie, Pegg and some of Myers) were solid. But it never reached high enough for something great and in any other movie, that twist ending would have knocked it down to a 3 or a 4/10. But that ending pushed the movie from mediocre to so bad its good territory for me. I can't call Terminal excellent but if you enjoy campy cinema, this is something you should see. I'm giving Terminal a 6/10 and I feel like I'm being generous.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":21313,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4,"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2018-05-11","keywords":"bare chested male bondage,tied to a bed,revenge,written by director,wager","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi671922201","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzU0Y2YwZDktYzc3Mi00ZjE3LWI3NmMtNjZiYmFlYTBlZTE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzU0Y2YwZDktYzc3Mi00ZjE3LWI3NmMtNjZiYmFlYTBlZTE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the dark heart of a sprawling, anonymous city, 'Terminal' follows the twisting tales of two assassins carrying out a sinister mission, a teacher battling a fatal illness, an enigmatic janitor and a curious waitress leading a dangerous double life. programme.title: Remember Me
Twój na zawsze
Remember Me
programme.desc:
Remember Me: Directed by Allen Coulter. With Caitlyn Rund, Moisés Acevedo, Noel Rodriguez, Kevin P. McCarthy. A romantic drama centered on two new lovers: Tyler, whose parents have split in the wake of his brother's suicide, and Ally, who lives each day to the fullest since witnessing her mother's murder." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1403981/","name":"Remember Me","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTA4MTg1ODkwNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzE5ODAxMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A romantic drama centered on two new lovers: Tyler, whose parents have split in the wake of his brother's suicide, and Ally, who lives each day to the fullest since witnessing her mother's murder.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1403981/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Southerngiftsu"},"dateCreated":"2010-03-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Same movie as pro critics?","reviewBody":"I walked away from the movie, Remember Me, asking myself one question. Did I just see the same movie I have heard several professional movie critics review negatively or indifferently? The first review I read online for Remember Me was that it was trite, predictable, and drawn out. (Bull, I say.) The responses of those around me in the theater today proved those claims false as well. I saw people laughing, gasping, wincing, and weeping. I saw the audience RELATING.

The characters are multi-dimensional and the acting is fantastic. This movie was not just feel-good fluff. It was not a platform to showcase Brosnan and Pattinson as eye candy. It was thought-provoking and intense. The characters were brooding, wounded, lovable and believable. The movie's twist was unique and effective.

If you want to see an enjoyable movie that will challenge your emotions and leave you feeling appropriately introspective, Remember Me fits the bills perfectly. (And there is nothing at all wrong with the added eye-candy benefit! ;)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":142953,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2010-03-31","keywords":"new york,new york city,binge drinking,september 11 2001,year 1991","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1472839961","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGJlMTgxMGMtZWE5NC00NjA1LWEzNTgtMmVhZGZjNTY0MzNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGJlMTgxMGMtZWE5NC00NjA1LWEzNTgtMmVhZGZjNTY0MzNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1500155/","name":"Robert Pattinson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0211087/","name":"Emilie de Ravin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3533310/","name":"Caitlyn Rund"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002339/","name":"Allen Coulter"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046206/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3391497/","name":"Will Fetters"}],"duration":"PT1H53M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Pineapple Express
Boski chillout
Pineapple Express
programme.desc:
Pineapple Express: Directed by David Gordon Green. With Seth Rogen, James Franco, Danny McBride, Kevin Corrigan. A process server and his marijuana dealer wind up on the run from hitmen and a corrupt police officer after he witnesses his dealer's boss murder a competitor while trying to serve papers on him." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0910936/","name":"Pineapple Express","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY1MTE4NzAwM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzg3Mjg2MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A process server and his marijuana dealer wind up on the run from hitmen and a corrupt police officer after he witnesses his dealer's boss murder a competitor while trying to serve papers on him.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0910936/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Michael_Elliott"},"dateCreated":"2009-01-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good Laughs","reviewBody":"Pineapple Express (2008) 

*** (out of 4) 

A pothead (Seth Rogan) and his dimwitted dealer (James Franco) hit the road after witnessing a cop (Rosie Perez) murder a man. Pretty soon the two are trying to get away from the cop as well as two drug lords in the middle of a war. As far as pot comedies goes this one here is nearly the best the small genre has to offer. I'm sure Cheech and Chong would give this thing two bongs up as it does contain plenty of laughs but I couldn't help but feel it had the same shortcomings as other Judd Apatow movies. That one issue with this film, as well as the others, is that it runs too long for its own good. Clocking in a nearly two-hours I couldn't help but feel that the film could have lost thirty-minutes and not much would have been missed. This is especially true during the ending shoot out, which just keeps going and going. Outside of that issue this film contains some great big laughs with most of them coming in the form of pot jokes and stuff dealing with stoners. Seth Rogan turns in another winning performance as he gains plenty of laughs from his older guy. James Franco is the real jewel in the film as he's dead-on perfect as the drug dealing loser who just sits around his house getting high, selling pot and watching reruns on television. Franco gets the look down just right but his facial gestures and voice tone perfectly capture that pot head many of us have met in our lives. I thought Perez was pretty much wasted in a thankless role that didn't offer her too much to do. Ed Begley, Jr. has a funny bit as Rogan's girlfriend's father. The screenplay really doesn't offer us any jokes we haven't seen countless times before and in many ways there's not an original idea here but that doesn't really matter because the performances are what makes the movie funny."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":327808,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2008-08-06","keywords":"stoner,falling downhill,watching tv,man tied up,handcuffed man","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Pineapple Express: Theatrical trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2729574681","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc4NTY4NzYxNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjk3NDEyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc4NTY4NzYxNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjk3NDEyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is the theatrical trailer for David Gordon Green's Pineapple Express."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0736622/","name":"Seth Rogen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0290556/","name":"James Franco"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0170550/","name":"Gary Cole"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0337773/","name":"David Gordon Green"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0073081/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0736622/","name":"Seth Rogen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1698571/","name":"Evan Goldberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0031976/","name":"Judd Apatow"}],"duration":"PT1H51M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0910936, Title: Pineapple Express, --- Description: Pineapple Express: Directed by David Gordon Green. With Seth Rogen, James Franco, Danny McBride, Kevin Corrigan. A process server and his marijuana dealer wind up on the run from hitmen and a corrupt police officer after he witnesses his dealer's boss murder a competitor while trying to serve papers on him." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0910936/","name":"Pineapple Express","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY1MTE4NzAwM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzg3Mjg2MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A process server and his marijuana dealer wind up on the run from hitmen and a corrupt police officer after he witnesses his dealer's boss murder a competitor while trying to serve papers on him.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0910936/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Michael_Elliott","dateCreated":"2009-01-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good Laughs","reviewBody":"Pineapple Express (2008) 

*** (out of 4) 

A pothead (Seth Rogan) and his dimwitted dealer (James Franco) hit the road after witnessing a cop (Rosie Perez) murder a man. Pretty soon the two are trying to get away from the cop as well as two drug lords in the middle of a war. As far as pot comedies goes this one here is nearly the best the small genre has to offer. I'm sure Cheech and Chong would give this thing two bongs up as it does contain plenty of laughs but I couldn't help but feel it had the same shortcomings as other Judd Apatow movies. That one issue with this film, as well as the others, is that it runs too long for its own good. Clocking in a nearly two-hours I couldn't help but feel that the film could have lost thirty-minutes and not much would have been missed. This is especially true during the ending shoot out, which just keeps going and going. Outside of that issue this film contains some great big laughs with most of them coming in the form of pot jokes and stuff dealing with stoners. Seth Rogan turns in another winning performance as he gains plenty of laughs from his older guy. James Franco is the real jewel in the film as he's dead-on perfect as the drug dealing loser who just sits around his house getting high, selling pot and watching reruns on television. Franco gets the look down just right but his facial gestures and voice tone perfectly capture that pot head many of us have met in our lives. I thought Perez was pretty much wasted in a thankless role that didn't offer her too much to do. Ed Begley, Jr. has a funny bit as Rogan's girlfriend's father. The screenplay really doesn't offer us any jokes we haven't seen countless times before and in many ways there's not an original idea here but that doesn't really matter because the performances are what makes the movie funny.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":327808,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2008-08-06","keywords":"stoner,falling downhill,watching tv,man tied up,handcuffed man","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Pineapple Express: Theatrical trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2729574681","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc4NTY4NzYxNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjk3NDEyMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc4NTY4NzYxNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjk3NDEyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is the theatrical trailer for David Gordon Green's Pineapple Express.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0736622/","name":"Seth Rogen","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0290556/","name":"James Franco","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0170550/","name":"Gary Cole"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0337773/","name":"David Gordon Green"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0073081/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0736622/","name":"Seth Rogen","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1698571/","name":"Evan Goldberg","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0031976/","name":"Judd Apatow"],"duration":"PT1H51M"</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Get Carter: Directed by Stephen Kay. With Sylvester Stallone, Miranda Richardson, Rachael Leigh Cook, Rhona Mitra. A Las Vegas mob enforcer travels back to his hometown to investigate his brother's mysterious death." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0208988/","name":"Get Carter","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkzMDk3Njg3NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNTIzMzU3._V1_.jpg","description":"A Las Vegas mob enforcer travels back to his hometown to investigate his brother's mysterious death.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0208988/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"thinker1691"},"dateCreated":"2011-04-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"" I'm the kind of guy your mother warned you about "","reviewBody":"In 1971, the first of these action, violence prone films was offered. In the original novel, written by Ted Lewis, it was Michael Caine who was the unstoppable, revenge filled Gangster out to discover who killed his brother. In this updated version directed by Stephen Kay, we have Sylvester Stallone playing Jack Carter. Both versions were very well conceived. The updated film has added the blood, gore and non-stop drama which is common with newer versions. The story remains the same in that Carter (Stallone) learns his younger brother died under suspicious circumstances and he is determined to learn why. Along the way, he is met with business types who are not interested in helping Carter find the truth. To that end, John C. McGinley, Mickey Rourke and even Michael Caine get in the action. The movie is filled with dark sequences, black violence and thrilling chase scenes, all of which add to the final outcome. Great movie and a worthy successor to the original. ****","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":33928,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2001-04-11","keywords":"enforcer,movie flop,cigarette,body lands on a car,character repeats someone else's dialogue","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Get Carter","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi550306585","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGFlZGQ2MTQtNDMwMS00YjFiLTk3OWItZWI1YzBhZjRmMzk2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGFlZGQ2MTQtNDMwMS00YjFiLTk3OWItZWI1YzBhZjRmMzk2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Warner Home Video"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000230/","name":"Sylvester Stallone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000337/","name":"Rachael Leigh Cook"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001669/","name":"Miranda Richardson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0443181/","name":"Stephen Kay"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033472/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043393/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052111/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0507794/","name":"Ted Lewis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0571346/","name":"David McKenna"}],"duration":"PT1H42M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Sneakers
Włamywacze
Sneakers
programme.desc:
Sneakers: Directed by Phil Alden Robinson. With Jo Marr, Gary Hershberger, Robert Redford, Sidney Poitier. A security pro finds his past coming back to haunt him, when he and his unique team are tasked with retrieving a particularly important item." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0105435/","name":"Sneakers","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTg0MTU0Y2YtNWEyNC00NDU3LWJhNjYtZGIzMWI0YWMwMTdhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjMwMjk0MTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A security pro finds his past coming back to haunt him, when he and his unique team are tasked with retrieving a particularly important item.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0105435/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"treeskier802"},"dateCreated":"2007-06-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Light-Hearted Caper Film","reviewBody":"I was drawn to Sneakers because I heard the story was of my favorite genre, a spy thriller. However, I found this movie to be more along the lines of a caper film.

Robert Redford is the leader of a team of experts who break into security systems so that institutions (such as banks) can see how good their system is. The team is made up of a diverse group: an ex-Cia agent (Portier) and three computer whizzes (Ackroyd, Phoenix, and the blind Stratharn). The group has great chemistry and often this leads to some fun humor.

Redford and his team are hired by the government (so they believe) to retrieve a black box that can decode encrypted computer firewalls. After retrieving the black box, the team finds themselves in dire trouble. 

I was hoping the film would be more intense, yet Sneakers incorporates a lot of humor. It is a fun film and is enjoyable to watch, but if you are looking for a true spy film, then you may want to pass.

This film more closely resembles recent movies like Ocean's 11 or The Italian Job, popcorn films that have some laughs, some danger, and some suspense.

Redford is really great in this movie as is Straitarn; Mary McDonnell is also very good. Phoenix holds his own. Although far from their best roles, Poitier, James Earl Jones, Ackroyd, and Ben Kingsley are decent.

Overall an enjoyable film which incorporates computer hacking before it was mainstream. Rating 7 of 10 stars.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":57027,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"1992-09-11","keywords":"computer,cryptography,security,nsa,encryption","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Sneakers","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi931725593","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjEzNGU0NzEtMzFlOC00OWYwLWFmZWUtYWVlOWEzNTI5MDk4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjEzNGU0NzEtMzFlOC00OWYwLWFmZWUtYWVlOWEzNTI5MDk4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Universal Studios Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000602/","name":"Robert Redford"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000101/","name":"Dan Aykroyd"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001627/","name":"Sidney Poitier"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004675/","name":"Phil Alden Robinson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009384/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004675/","name":"Phil Alden Robinson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0489623/","name":"Lawrence Lasker"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0662748/","name":"Walter F. programme.title: Air America
Air America
programme.desc:
Air America: Directed by Roger Spottiswoode. With Mel Gibson, Robert Downey Jr., Nancy Travis, Ken Jenkins. A young pilot finds himself recruited unwittingly into a covert and corrupt C.I.A. airlift organization operating in Vietnam War-era Laos." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0099005/","name":"Air America","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDRiNzdlYzUtNzIxMy00OGI4LThlNjQtNTI3Njg5NjVlOWJkL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjQzNDI3NzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young pilot finds himself recruited unwittingly into a covert and corrupt C.I.A. airlift organization operating in Vietnam War-era Laos.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0099005/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Howlin Wolf"},"dateCreated":"2001-04-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"An interesting little film...","reviewBody":"... because, whilst it doesn't have anything overly outstanding about it, it manages to be very entertaining. Perhaps it's just because the pairing of Gibson and Downey, Jr. appeals to me. Whatever it is, I found the setup interesting, the comedy funny and the action nicely staged.

I'm tempted to say that its lukewarm reception was down to poor marketing, but I'm not sure that's true. Maybe I just have to accept that I quite like a movie that the majority think is bad.

I don't know what it is with Gibson and 'non-Lethal-Weapon' action comedies, but "Bird on a Wire" seems to be regarded as another commercial failure, and I enjoyed that one too. Perhaps it's just because the pairing of Gibson and Downey, Jr. appeals to me. Whatever it is, I found the setup interesting, the comedy funny and the action nicely staged.

I'm tempted to say that its lukewarm reception was down to poor marketing, but I'm not sure that's true. Maybe I just have to accept that I quite like a movie that the majority think is bad.

I don't know what it is with Gibson and 'non-Lethal-Weapon' action comedies, but "Bird on a Wire" seems to be regarded as another commercial failure, and I enjoyed that one too. Top notch movie.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":99580,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"1993-07-09","keywords":"interrupted sex,assassin,assassination,assassination attempt,american president","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"In The Line of Fire","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2693857561","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDAwYWQyZjMtYmZkNy00MTM1LTljNTUtMWM4MDEzM2I5ZDBmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDAwYWQyZjMtYmZkNy00MTM1LTljNTUtMWM4MDEzM2I5ZDBmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Columbia Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000142/","name":"Clint Eastwood"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000518/","name":"John Malkovich"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000623/","name":"Rene Russo"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000583/","name":"Wolfgang Petersen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040620/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0536587/","name":"Jeff Maguire"}],"duration":"PT2H8M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Open Season 3
Sezon na misia 3
Open Season 3
programme.desc:
Open Season 3: Directed by Cody Cameron. With Matthew J. Munn, Nika Futterman, Maddie Taylor, André Sogliuzzo. Boog's friends rally to bring him home from a Russian traveling circus." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1646926/","name":"Open Season 3","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTlmZWUxZjctYmVmZS00MTNlLTllZmMtNGZiMjIzOWRlY2M0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjIzODI5OTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Boog's friends rally to bring him home from a Russian traveling circus.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1646926/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"gavin6942"},"dateCreated":"2011-01-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Probably the Death of a Series","reviewBody":"Boog plans a guy's trip, but all his friends back out for one reason or another. He goes alone and stumbles on to a circus and a beautiful female bear named Ursa. Switching places with a male bear named Doug, his friends in the forest soon become worried.

The reviews for this film are not stellar, and I think I can sum up why: the original voice cast is not involved in this picture, so the characters sound funny. The plot is thin, and the movie comes in under 90 minutes, letting you know that they didn't have a strong story (even including the dogs and cats seems forced because it is not related to the main story at all).

For me, I liked the film. I don't have a strong attachment to the original, so I wasn't as offended. And I think kids will like it. Sure, the voice for Boog was annoying... but then, I loved the dogs and cats, so it's a toss-up. I felt like this was going to be a launching pad for a TV series, because it has a "Madagascar" feel to it... but with its poor reception, that may not be likely.

If you have kids, let them check it out. They may be less cynical than adult viewers, and it's not all bad. I learned what a camelid is... that may be worth the price of renting the film. But then again, maybe not. My girlfriend watched it with me and fell asleep... what does that tell you?","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":11099,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.1},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2011-01-25","keywords":"russian,circus,prince and pauper,look alike,role reversal","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Open Season 3","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi205691161","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ4NjExNjI0MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDg3MTczMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ4NjExNjI0MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDg3MTczMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Boog's friends really to bring him home from a Russian traveling circus."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3103829/","name":"Matthew J. Munn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0296546/","name":"Nika Futterman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2407919/","name":"Maddie Taylor"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0970606/","name":"Cody Cameron"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0051162/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0121181/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0137811/","name":"John B. programme.title: Surf's Up 2: WaveMania
Na fali 2
Surf's Up 2: WaveMania
programme.desc: Surf's Up 2: WaveMania: Directed by Henry Yu. With Jeremy Shada, Jon Heder, Melissa Sturm, John Cena. An animated comedy that features WWE Superstars, providing their own voices while matching up against talking animals." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5513260/","name":"Surf's Up 2: WaveMania","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjJkNjM4ODUtNDJlYy00ZGI1LTk1OTctODc2OWJlNmM1YTM3L2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTM3MDMyMDQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"An animated comedy that features WWE Superstars, providing their own voices while matching up against talking animals.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5513260/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"deirdre-76313"},"dateCreated":"2018-12-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"A pathetic attempt","reviewBody":"As a huge fan of the first movie, this was the worst sequel I have ever seen. Main characters from the last movie weren't even there and the storyline was completely changed. The WWE character idea doesn't have anything to do with surfing. If it was just a movie on its own, unrelated to Surf's Up... ok, maybe? But do NOT call this Surf's Up. Plus, there was no actual surfing in it. The original movie didn't leave us needing another movie to finish the story because the story was already done. programme.title: Money Monster
Zakładnik z Wall Street
Money Monster
programme.desc:
Money Monster: Directed by Jodie Foster. With George Clooney, Julia Roberts, Jack O'Connell, Dominic West. Financial TV host Lee Gates and his producer Patty are put in an extreme situation when an irate investor takes them and their crew as hostage." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2241351/","name":"Money Monster","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgzMjU1NDUwMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODg1NjY0ODE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Financial TV host Lee Gates and his producer Patty are put in an extreme situation when an irate investor takes them and their crew as hostage.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2241351/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"samerabdallah"},"dateCreated":"2016-06-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"Solid and engaging thriller with a timely topic","reviewBody":"This is one of few real time films -meaning the flow of events matches the duration of the film- that is quite successful in keeping the viewer's attention all along, and Jodie Foster is very efficient as a director presenting what seems initially a daunting technical subject (how a computer "glitch" causes an 800 Million Dollar loss to shareholders in a public traded company) as a dramatic thriller that never looses pace.

The cast is excellent, Julia Roberts as the ever conscious producer calculating how each camera angle is best to follow on the unfolding live drama, George Clooney in one of his finest roles as the careless theatrical advice giver of the money program who gradually comes to realize how damaging his show is to the masses (in one particular touching scene he is in the street in NY and sees on-lookers imitating his dance moves on the show, and he becomes aware of what a buffoon he is), and finally Jack O'Connel who is very convincing as the candid investor who really wants to know how "the system" works (casting him was an inspired choice, he is not a well-known actor so he adds more credibility to the character he plays, a simple man from the street who looses all his money in Wall Street). None of the main or even secondary characters in the film are one dimensional, they have their problems (like lonely dinners for some) and concerns and values, whether it is the camera man or the public relations lady officer reporting to the big CEO, or even the main police officers in charge, all are multi-dimensional characters and their human aspects are not ignored. 

Even though the film deals with a serious subject, an eye opener leading one to wonder about the real money monsters out there, it remains an excellent thriller with top class actors.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":98054,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2016-05-13","keywords":"fictional tv network,financial thriller,money,hostage,death","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3048191257","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU5NTA3MjUyOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODg5MjA3NzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU5NTA3MjUyOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODg5MjA3NzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Lee Gates (George Clooney) is a bombastic TV personality whose popular financial network show has made him the money wiz of Wall Street. But after he hawks a high tech stock that mysteriously crashes, an irate investor (Jack O'Connell) takes Gates, his crew, and his ace producer Patty Fenn (Julia Roberts) hostage live on air. Unfolding in real time, Gates and Fenn must find a way to keep themselves alive while simultaneously uncovering the truth behind a tangle of big money lies."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000123/","name":"George Clooney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000210/","name":"Julia Roberts"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1925239/","name":"Jack O'Connell"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000149/","name":"Jodie Foster"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005883/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0479739/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0184096/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1956691/","name":"Jamie Linden"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0223804/","name":"Alan DiFiore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0467942/","name":"Jim Kouf"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="
